story:
About

 

 

SLEEPMAN UPGRADES ARE BASED ON KICKSTARTER COMMUNITY ADVICES AND SUGGESTIONS. We’ve cancelled our successfully funded Kickstarter campaign just over a year ago to implement our backer’s ideas and address their concerns. Finally, we are back with new Sleepman: smaller, sleeker, and fully upgraded. We’ve focused on the features that are crucial to our wellbeing, needed by most of us and unique to the Sleepman.

Sleepman with optional click-on display

 

Check your activity level, sleeping data, meditate, or even watch your heart rate in real time without looking at your phone. An optional Sleepman display can be programmed to show the info you prefer. Components we’ve chosen do not consume much energy and would not significantly decrease your battery life. The optional display shares the plugin connectors with the Sleep Enhancer signal amplifier electrode and simply clicks on. It is not mandatory to have the display on for your Sleepman to work properly, it’s rather an accessory for your convenience. A display frame is compatible with any regular 22 mm watch band or bracelet of your choice. If you’d like to have an optional screen please add $29 to your pledge for each Sleepman unit.

 

 

 

 

 

The unique E-magnetic Enhancer generates scientifically designed and thoroughly tested micro-current impulses. They intensify your night sleep or daytime power relaxation, gently and absolutely safely. You may not feel them, but they are very effective due to Sleepmans' self-learning algorithms that adjust the impulses to your individual bio-rhythms.

 

 

Daytime drowsiness is our common enemy. Sleepman monitors your activity level and wouldn't let you lose control by warning you of tiredness and focus loss.

 

 

Always wake up on the right side of a bed with Sleepman! Intensified sleep helps you feel energized and Sleepman Power Relaxation Mode takes care of daytime drowsiness even if you have only 15 minutes to spare while working, driving, traveling or staying home.

 

 

"It’s so great to see how deep this product goes into complexity to ensure a person’s better life well being by enhancing the every aspect of your sleep, truly fascinated!"

"Hi guys, I have just backed, looks like a great project!"

"All the best to your project restart...and be sure that I will support you again"

“Thank you for being up-front an honorable about all of this; I will absolutely be back for the next round. ^‿^"

 

 

 

Poor sleep & not enough rest are public health epidemics - about 87% of people suffer from sleeping problems! Nothing affects our mood, productivity and creativity as badly as a bad night sleep and a daytime fatigue. By helping you sleep better and boost your energy, Sleepman can make you look younger, and improve your daily performance, memory, general health and wellbeing.

 

 

 

Sleepman stores the history of your heart rhythms, oxygen levels, sleep patterns, daytime tiredness levels, etc. This information can be crucial for early diagnostics of dangerous heart arrhythmias, high blood pressure, sleep apnea and other health issues. The history may help your physician to diagnose your disorders better, cure them more effectively and even prevent the disorders. Sleepman is not a medical device and shouldn’t be treated as one. However, if a health problem happens, Sleepman may help your body to recover much fasterby enhancing your sleep and relaxation.

The estimated Sleepman MSRP is $200 and we've decided to include the optional E-magnetic Enhancer ($50 MSRP) as a gift with every Sleepman unit to our Kickstarter backers. Shipping to US is $8 and international shipping is $19 for any number of Sleepman devices at any pledge level.

In the Box: 1 Sleepman device (your choice of black or white), 1 USB charger, 1 E-magnetic Impulse Attachment with software and 2 gel electrodes (each electrode can be used up to 100 times), 2 hypoallergenic silicon slap bracelets (black and white), and Sleepman App Download Code.

 

Options and Extras

Click-on Display Kit

An optional click-on display kit includes 1 display (black or white) all needed software, one silicon band (black or white) and a set of 22 mm spring bars. Please add $29 to your pledge for each kit unless it is already included in your pledge reward.

An executive genuine leather kit.

Please add $19 to your pledge for each set unless it is already included in your pledge reward. This option includes 1 leather strap with matte black rings, a hole puncher and an easy adjustment instruction. It can hold Sleepman on either side of a wrist and can be adjusted for any hand.

 

 

 

The secret to waking up full of energy every day is in the timing. You need to be awaken in the right sleep stage, otherwise you might feel groggy. Sleepman's Smart Alarm uses the best available Electrodermal Bio-Activity algorithms to accurately monitor your continually alternating sleep stages during the night and always wakes you up at the right moment closest to your alarm time.

Optional E-Magnetic Sleep Enhancer helps to improve your sleep making it more efficient and restful. In a Night Sleep Enhancement Mode, the device emits series of scientifically calculated micro-impulses increasing duration of the most restful deep sleep stages, so you gain more energy from shorter sleep. Although the Enhancer is safe to wear regularly throughout the night, every night use isn’t needed because it’s effect is a long-lasting.

 

 

Sleep experts found that 15 – 20 min power napping or full relaxation is the most effective way to recharge yourself, improve alertness, productivity, and mood throughout the day. The key to effective Power Nap is to be awaken just before you fall from a light sleep into a deep sleep. Sleepman accurately detects the optimal moment to get you back to your activity well re-energized and stress-relieved.

Optional E-Magnetic Sleep Enhancer in its Power Relaxation Mode strengthens the effects of a short rest by sending stimulation impulses to your nervous system. The impulses help you fully relax and intensify re-energizing process.

 

 

Daytime drowsiness and unnoticed fatigue decreases your productivity and abilities to achieve goals whether you work, study or just playing games. Do not lose a game, a relationship, a job, or even your life due to the loss of concentration. According to NHTSA over 100,000 crashes yearly only in US are attributed to driver’s fatigue. Sleepman monitors your alertness level and warns you at the earliest signs of focus loss, right on time for a coffee break or a power nap. Be safe and successful with Sleepman.

 

 

We’ve designed the new Sleepman to be your companion around the clock. It is elegant, modern-looking and can perfectly match any outfit for any occasion with easy-changeable colorful hypoallergenic one-size-fits-all slap bracelets that are equally comfortable for any hand, large or small, right or left!

 

 

 

Sleepman App fully controls the device and provides information on your sleep patterns, daytime activity and concentration levels presented in clear and easy-to-understand visual graphs. You will be able to see how a good night sleep and daytime power naps increase your wellbeing and easily adjust your routines to improve your daily performance and the quality of your sleep.

 

 

We have been working on bringing a good night’s sleep to the world for more than three years and now we are ready to share the new Sleepman with you. Sleepman monitors your brain activity and sleep stages through Electro-Dermal Activity (EDA) sensors using the most advanced EDA bio-signal tracking algorithms, thoroughly tested, and optimized for more than two decades. EDA monitoring is highly accurate, non-intrusive and does not interfere with your neuro-activity. After the cancellation of our successful 2016 Kickstarter campaign we’ve added heart and oxygen monitors, implemented e-magnetic enhancement system, made new Sleepman water-resistant and more comfortable to wear due to our self-adjustable slap-bracelets that could be put on or changed with one click.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Risks and challenges

We know that bringing a new product to market is a complicated and time consuming process. The Sleepman team has a wealth of experience in developing and refining products for the mass market and are confident that we can deliver Sleepman as promised.
Based on our previous experience with new products, we understand that unexpected problems and delays with manufacturing and delivery can arise. We’re in talks with manufacturing and assembly partners and are realistic about delivery. We promise to work hard and address any challenges that may arise. We also promise to keep you well-updated on every step of our progress. If any unexpected trouble occurs, you’ll be the first to know about the problem and our way of handling it. The most important phase of our project is to bring Sleepman to you, our backers. We’ll do our best to deliver it on time and exceed your expectations!

story:
The App collects advices and questions asked to a close group of people. For example you would like to have an advice from your parents concerning a new job opportunity you have, because you are not sure if it’s a good one. You send your question, collect advices and make a better decision, because you may see this situation from another point of view. Many other features are available to customize your question and get more information. 

Whether your question is simple or complex, you will be able to get opinions and answers that you didn’t have before. You can get instant answers using the “urgent question” option, which is a short question sent to the telephone home screen of the group you have selected. In the other hand you can send a survey that lasts for days or even weeks. In this case you might use it as a temporal research, where you will collect data through a long period of time.

This project will build a system where users don’t feel alone anymore when they are making a decision. We put people in your pocket to ask them what you want, how you want.

         

You can choose different types of questions such as yes or no, rate, open and option, use pictures to custom your scenario, select people you want, send it and wait for their advices. With this application you will also receive questions by your friends and get the opportunity to help them through hard times.

We are Sara (industrial designer) and Remo (engineer), and since we were students we have been far from home. For different reasons, lots of people around the world are in this situation. We realized that everybody should communicate more with their family, siblings, friends and talking more with them about their life. These people are important. Specially when we need to take important decisions and they are not near us.

We live in Pisa, Tuscany. We have found an inspiring place here, where we work and try to build our dreams.

We thought we could create a different way of communication among family members, friends, colleagues, sports partners, etc. There are many communication systems out there, but our idea is a simple tool that helps people in decision making, bringing accurate advices from reliable people.

The project start is getting closer and we really need people like you. Your donation will help us hire the programmer and the computer services necessary to complete our work. So far we have developed the idea, the interface, the functionalities and the design! We have chosen the Fixed Funding option, because we need exactly what we ask for. We are not interested on making something different than our goal and we want to guarantee that your contribution is safe. Your donation is refunded if the goal is not reached.

9€ donation: You receive our most sincere regards. Your collaboration means a lot for us! 

25€ donation: You get a guide on how to create an app! We will provide an easy guide including strategy applied, useful illustrations, design tips, tools used and economic advice. Every week, during one month, we send a report containing useful information on how to build and manage the development of a Mobile Application (programming excluded).


49€ donation: All the above + you are involved in the test and troubleshooting of the App through a trial version exclusivity. 


360€ donation: All the above + your name will be listed on the acknowledgements page of the app.


2000€ donation:  All the above + one day guided visit for you and one friend in Pisa, Italy. 1 night in a 4 star hotel included. (Food and transportation to/from Pisa are not included) If you are using PayPal as a guest, you will not be able to contribute more than $500 or €366. In this case we recommend creating a PayPal account.


We really appreciate your help! We would be glad to receive all kinds of collaboration, even if your not giving us funds you can help us spread the word and tell friends about our project, just share our link through the social networks you use. You can also give us your advise via e-mail. We will be happy to hear from all of you.

Thanks and remain curious!

story:
What is a 21st Century Miner?

Bitcoin (BTC) is a decentralized digital currency which is "mined" or minted by pure computing power. It's like gold mining for computers but with some exciting and innovative technology involved. We will soon see advances in technology which have been brought about by the BTC network and these will be beyond what many can currently imagine. BTC has been around for 4 years and is the most widely used alternative currency in the world. At the current market price, the BTC in circulation today is worth around 150 million US Dollars. There's never been anything as successful as BTC and it will be exciting to see where BTC takes us over the next 10-20 years.

I've followed  BTC over the last four years and would have loved to have been involved other than as an observer from day one but I've always had enough going on with work, study (whilst working), starting and raising a family that I've never had the time to commit to being a 21st century miner.

Now I'm in a position where I don't need to invest so much time into those things, I want to get involved.  BTC is still relatively new but undoubtedly exciting and with the release of Application Specific Integrated Circuits (ASICs) as tools for mining, technological advances which will improve on the current equipment will be ground breaking. With all the new things happening in this technology, who wouldn't want to be part of it?

What I Need

Other than 30,487 people to give me $1 each?

There are a range of options when it comes BTC mining. Anybody who has done even a small bit of research will know there are only a few companies producing the hardware needed to be competitive in the BTC mining world. One such company is Butterfly Labs (BFL) who I’ve been following for almost a year. I want to buy BFL ASICs and not just any ASICs because despite having a range of devices I could purchase, I’m shooting for the stars. I'm going for the big kahuna of mining gear; the BFL Minirig.

 

The BFL Minirig provides the best return per dollar in the BTC mining scene. At 1500 GigaHashes per second, it literally screams through the BTC network seeking the elusive rewards hidden in the data blocks.  But it comes at a cost of US$29899 plus shipping ($30487 all up) which is what I’m seeking and on top of that, I’ll be paying all customs and import duties.

How I’ll Use It

Once I’ve get a Minirig funded, I’ll use it to mine like crazy until I have generated enough BTC to purchase a 2nd Minirig. I’m estimating this will take around 260 days. The first Minirig then continues generating BTC which will be turned into the Casascius perks and returned to the campaign investors at the end of the first year while the 2nd Minirig will be used to generate the perks for those investors who will receive the Minirig mining proceeds.

After the first year, 100% the BTC generated by the 1st Minirig (which you have funded) will be used to fund Indiegogo campaigns on a monthly basis. The actual dollar amount will vary depending on the market rate for BTC. By the end of the first year, I will setup a website through which investors in this campaign can nominate and vote for any Indiegogo campaign they believe deserves funding. Each month, on behalf of the voting community, the winning campaign as voted by investors will receive the equivalent of one month’s BTC generation from the first Minirig which you have funded. No campaign will be allowed to receive more than one donation from this process as I want to make sure we spread the love far and wide. That’s my perpetual “giving back” to the community that is helping me get started and this will be a forever on-going process until such time as the Minirig stops working and can’t be fixed or the BTC runs out – whichever comes first.

So you’re funding my entry into the BTC mining scene which will allow me to generate enough BTC to purchase additional mining equipment. After the first year, the funding you have provided will enable me to provide a perpetual donation to investor-chosen Indiegogo campaigns on a monthly basis.

What Have I Based Those Figures On?

Bitcoin 101

Hopefully I can explain how Bitcoins come into existence and how I figure I’ll be able to generate sufficient Bitcoin to be able to purchase a 2nd Minirig AND setup a perpetual investment into Indiegogo campaigns after the first year.

Bitcoins are “minted” at a predetermined rate which is roughly one block every 10 minutes. When the Bitcoin network hash-rate increases (as it will when new technology hits the network), the time taken to mine a block will decrease to less than 10 minutes. In order to maintain the 10 minute mining rate, there is a variable introduced into the network called difficulty. When the network hash-rate increases (reducing the speed of which a block is mined), difficulty also increases to bring the mining speed back to 10 minutes per block. In theory, this will maintain the ability to mine Bitcoins until around 2040 (give or take a year or so).

There is no accurate way to predict what the network hash-rate or difficulty will be in one, two, six or 12 months from today but you can make some educated guesses. Best guess at the moment is a jump of 1000% (10x current) for the network difficulty. If that’s the case, a BFL Minirig can be paid off in 88 days but you’ll recall I said 260 days so I’m obviously using a difficulty factor a little higher than what many people are speculating.

For all of my calculations, I’m using a change of 3000% of the current hash-rate and difficulty which, some might claim is unrealistic but let’s face it, my worst case scenario of 3000% allows me plenty of scope to meet or exceed those deadlines I’ve stated I’d like to achieve. There’s no real way to accurately predict what the difficulty will be once ASIC’s hit the market but the world is “guessing” 1000% (10x) and I’m working on 3000% (30x). I figure the world and I will meet someplace in the middle and my goals will be met either on time or earlier.

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand this is a big leap of faith for some investors and appreciate you might wish me well but don't want to part with your hard earned cash for this particular venture and I’m OK with that.

Please copy and paste my link (http://t.co/M6WgWWhv) on your Facebook, Twitter, Google+, Tumblr, Reddit, Pinterest and any other Social Media pages. If I can get  30,000 people to give me $1 each I’ll be on track to achieving my goals. I'd sure appreciate the referrals and who knows, maybe one of you is six degrees of separation away from somebody willing to front what I want or more.

Irrespective, please spread the word about Indiegogo - if it wasn't for sites like this, the little guys might never get the break they need.
story_txt:
What is a 21st Century Miner?
Bitcoin (BTC) is a decentralized digital currency which is "mined" or minted by pure computing power. It's like gold mining for computers but with some exciting and innovative technology involved. We will soon see advances in technology which have been brought about by the BTC network and these will be beyond what many can currently imagine. BTC has been around for 4 years and is the most widely used alternative currency in the world. At the current market price, the BTC in circulation today is worth around 150 million US Dollars. There's never been anything as successful as BTC and it will be exciting to see where BTC takes us over the next 10-20 years.
I've followed  BTC over the last four years and would have loved to have been involved other than as an observer from day one but I've always had enough going on with work, study (whilst working), starting and raising a family that I've never had the time to commit to being a 21st century miner.
Now I'm in a position where I don't need to invest so much time into those things, I want to get involved.  BTC is still relatively new but undoubtedly exciting and with the release of Application Specific Integrated Circuits (ASICs) as tools for mining, technological advances which will improve on the current equipment will be ground breaking. With all the new things happening in this technology, who wouldn't want to be part of it?
What I Need
Other than 30,487 people to give me $1 each?
There are a range of options when it comes BTC mining. Anybody who has done even a small bit of research will know there are only a few companies producing the hardware needed to be competitive in the BTC mining world. One such company is Butterfly Labs (BFL) who I’ve been following for almost a year. I want to buy BFL ASICs and not just any ASICs because despite having a range of devices I could purchase, I’m shooting for the stars. I'm going for the big kahuna of mining gear; the BFL Minirig.
 
The BFL Minirig provides the best return per dollar in the BTC mining scene. At 1500 GigaHashes per second, it literally screams through the BTC network seeking the elusive rewards hidden in the data blocks.  But it comes at a cost of US$29899 plus shipping ($30487 all up) which is what I’m seeking and on top of that, I’ll be paying all customs and import duties.
How I’ll Use It
Once I’ve get a Minirig funded, I’ll use it to mine like crazy until I have generated enough BTC to purchase a 2nd Minirig. I’m estimating this will take around 260 days. The first Minirig then continues generating BTC which will be turned into the Casascius perks and returned to the campaign investors at the end of the first year while the 2nd Minirig will be used to generate the perks for those investors who will receive the Minirig mining proceeds.
After the first year, 100% the BTC generated by the 1st Minirig (which you have funded) will be used to fund Indiegogo campaigns on a monthly basis. The actual dollar amount will vary depending on the market rate for BTC. By the end of the first year, I will setup a website through which investors in this campaign can nominate and vote for any Indiegogo campaign they believe deserves funding. Each month, on behalf of the voting community, the winning campaign as voted by investors will receive the equivalent of one month’s BTC generation from the first Minirig which you have funded. No campaign will be allowed to receive more than one donation from this process as I want to make sure we spread the love far and wide. That’s my perpetual “giving back” to the community that is helping me get started and this will be a forever on-going process until such time as the Minirig stops working and can’t be fixed or the BTC runs out – whichever comes first.
So you’re funding my entry into the BTC mining scene which will allow me to generate enough BTC to purchase additional mining equipment. After the first year, the funding you have provided will enable me to provide a perpetual donation to investor-chosen Indiegogo campaigns on a monthly basis.
What Have I Based Those Figures On?
Bitcoin 101
Hopefully I can explain how Bitcoins come into existence and how I figure I’ll be able to generate sufficient Bitcoin to be able to purchase a 2nd Minirig AND setup a perpetual investment into Indiegogo campaigns after the first year.
Bitcoins are “minted” at a predetermined rate which is roughly one block every 10 minutes. When the Bitcoin network hash-rate increases (as it will when new technology hits the network), the time taken to mine a block will decrease to less than 10 minutes. In order to maintain the 10 minute mining rate, there is a variable introduced into the network called difficulty. When the network hash-rate increases (reducing the speed of which a block is mined), difficulty also increases to bring the mining speed back to 10 minutes per block. In theory, this will maintain the ability to mine Bitcoins until around 2040 (give or take a year or so).
There is no accurate way to predict what the network hash-rate or difficulty will be in one, two, six or 12 months from today but you can make some educated guesses. Best guess at the moment is a jump of 1000% (10x current) for the network difficulty. If that’s the case, a BFL Minirig can be paid off in 88 days but you’ll recall I said 260 days so I’m obviously using a difficulty factor a little higher than what many people are speculating.
For all of my calculations, I’m using a change of 3000% of the current hash-rate and difficulty which, some might claim is unrealistic but let’s face it, my worst case scenario of 3000% allows me plenty of scope to meet or exceed those deadlines I’ve stated I’d like to achieve. There’s no real way to accurately predict what the difficulty will be once ASIC’s hit the market but the world is “guessing” 1000% (10x) and I’m working on 3000% (30x). I figure the world and I will meet someplace in the middle and my goals will be met either on time or earlier.
Other Ways You Can Help
I understand this is a big leap of faith for some investors and appreciate you might wish me well but don't want to part with your hard earned cash for this particular venture and I’m OK with that.
Please copy and paste my link (http://t.co/M6WgWWhv) on your Facebook, Twitter, Google+, Tumblr, Reddit, Pinterest and any other Social Media pages. If I can get  30,000 people to give me $1 each I’ll be on track to achieving my goals. I'd sure appreciate the referrals and who knows, maybe one of you is six degrees of separation away from somebody willing to front what I want or more.
Irrespective, please spread the word about Indiegogo - if it wasn't for sites like this, the little guys might never get the break they need.

story:
CREATIVE ANARKY -  and the Art and Science of Touch!

How cool does that sound? What does it mean?

Our ethos is about democratising 3D digital modelling, re-drawing the conventional boundaries by using a software/hardware system that gives you the user a very real sense of touch for a more natural way of working. You have the opportunity to put the ‘passion’ back into digital creativity and the creative freedom to stretch the scope of your imagination.

And the great news is that our software/hardware system, our Anarkik 3D Design package that Farah is using in the video, is up for a 3DPrintShow Global Award in the ‘Best Consumer Software’ category. This is fantastic and we are thrilled! 

(You can vote for us at this link: http://rki.lt/15znnRs as the award is voted for by the public and is not a panel vote. And the award event is in London on 7th Nov 2013.)

Our campaign is about generating greater awareness of our Anarkik 3D Design package: it combines our creative software ‘Cloud9’ with a 3D haptic device to give the real and powerful sensation of touch and feel to 3D modelling, plus movement in 3D to more intuitively navigate in a virtual 3D work space.

Add to this the readily available 3D printing facilities and your models can be transformed into real innovative customised objects, all at a fraction of the cost not previously thought possible.

Why is this such a powerful and valued concept?

Not only does Anarkik 3D Design software enable designer makers, artists and creative enthusiasts to have full freedom of expression, applied arts and craft businesses have a digital tool which can provide a distinctive edge and differentiation because it supports working in 3D through more intuitive 3D interaction.  After all it is more natural for designers, artists and makers to think in 3D and work in 3D.

Image: ‘3D Consequences’ project : 4 designer makers using Anarkik 3D Design package and swopping designs through 3 iterations so each works on another's model, resulting in 12 objects for 3D printing. The 4 are: Farah Bandookwala, Elizabeth Armour, Ann Marie Shillito and newbie, Lucy Robertson, who had little or no experience before this project of 3D modelling and 3D printing.

The ability to create with touch and feel can provide other major benefits: for example, offering challenges to heads and hands is a key feature of the creative education process and can be part of clinical therapy to aid recovery for cognitive, brain and stroke conditions.

Why are we seeking your help?

We are making sales. We want to make more sales to invest in development and enable as many users as possible to benefit from the unique capabilities of our product and access 3D printing.

As with all innovatory products, building market awareness and understanding is critical to stimulate interest. As we have found from experience, 3D haptics is different and is something that most people have not experienced. The only effective way to "get" the experience and grasp the significance of touch for digital 3D designing is by a hands-on demonstration.

The best way to achieve this is by being in the market place. This means being at shows and exhibitions, giving hands-on demonstrations and presentations.

A major show coming up on 7-9 November is the 3DPrintShow in London. We need to be there and well manned for the full 3 days. As a small business in this sector we cannot afford not to be there.  The cost to exhibit, present an illustrative range of 3D printed models, for travel and accommodation, etc, for at least 4 people, and to produce the range of perks which we hope will attract you to support us to do this, is £10000. If we can raise more, this can help us to attend more shows and initiate fun, educational projects to spread the word and awareness more extensively.

Can you, will you help us?

If you would like to support us and don’t want a perk your generous donation of £10 (Perk 1) will go even further than you know in helping us towards our goal!

What we can offer in return for donations is a range of great perks. Please scroll down for details and options on each perk:

~ 3D models (designed using Anarkik 3D Design) for you to get 3D printed: ‘DIY’ (Perk 2: models A, B, C or D)

~ 3D printed objects designed using Anarkik 3D Design (Perk 3: models A or B, Perk 6: models B – G and 1 – 3), and the option for personalising two of them with initials (Perk 7).

~ signed copies of Ann Marie Shillito`s book, “Digital Crafts : Industrial Technologies for applied artists and designer makers” * (Perk 4, and Perk 5 - personalised), published on 10th October.

~ 2 day comprehensive course on 3D modelling and designing for 3D printing (Perk 8).

~ Anarkik 3D Design package (software bundled with a Falcon haptic device) (Perk 9).

~ fun 1 day package for up to 4 people using Anarkik 3D Design to 3D model (Perk 10).

~ special limited edition rings (3 only) in 3D printed titanium(Perk 11).

~ a big bundle package (Anarkik 3D Design plus 3 day course for 1 or 2 people) (Perk 12).

* Ann Marie Shillito`s book, “Digital Crafts : Industrial Technologies for applied artists and designer makers” is about how designer makers are already accessing and using digital technologies. The book is both inspirational, with 200 colour images of work, and useful with information about the different technologies and what you need to know to get access to them.

Background 

Anarkik 3D Design as a 3D modelling system grew out of founder Ann Marie Shillito`s vision for a way of working and designing digitally in 3D, more attuned to designer makers’ needs and methods of working,offering a way around the barriers presented by traditional, standard computer aided design packages. Makers think and do in 3D so Anarkik 3D Design works this way.

Image: Haptic - the sense of touch - how do you get across the sensation of actually touching a virtual object other than physically experiencing this?

It is this that is so special about Anarkik 3D Design: the use of 3D haptics and physically moving your hand in 3 dimensions, in x, y and z axes. Haptics means 'touch' and a Falcon haptic device provides not only the capability to touch and feel in 3D, to feel the process of modelling, shaping and constructing,  you also more easily move and navigate within your virtual 3D work space and ‘know’ where you are. This makes Anarkik 3D Design very accessible, easy to learn and enjoyable to use. It looks strange and the sensation is strange - but only for a very short time because it taps into how we naturally interact with 3 dimensional things in the real world.

Affordable, and easy to learn and use, Anarkik 3D Design offers the means to produce unique, customised and innovatory items and jewellery.

Image: 3D printed rings from designs by jeweller Birgit Laken using her Anarkik 3D Design package, her perk through our crowdfunding campaign in 2012.

Access to 3D printing technology gives the capability and the capacity to produce in a diverse range of materials including precious metals, such as titanium, gold and silver, as well as ceramics, steel, nylon, bronze, composites, glass, plastics and even chocolate. 

As an example of what is possible, one of the most treasured things that Ann Marie created is the wedding ring in titanium that her eldest daughter Kari wanted so much, as featured below. The wedding ring and the interlocking engagement ring were designed, in consultation with Kari, using our Anarkik 3D Design software system, then prototypes were 3D printed to test for fit, and finally the wedding ring was 3D printed in titanium.

How is this affordable?

Anarkik 3D Design costs £600 (approx $900/€700). This is a bundle price for both software (Cloud9) and the Falcon haptic device and can be bought from our company’s distributors or direct as a special offer from us only during this crowdfunding project. 

You can also buy your own 3D printer – prices can be as low as £700 – or as we also do, use commercial web-based 3D printing companies for a professional service and much wider range of 3D printing materials. 

About Anarkik3D Ltd: the Team: 

Ann Marie Shillito: Anarkik3D founder and CEO

Software development and management: 

Xiaoqing Cao: Anarkik3D founder and haptics consultant 

Qi Ma: software consultant re software development and support 

Alex Shaw: technical manager/developer (freelance) 

Elizabeth Armour:Anarkik 3D Design product presenter for 3DPrintShow (freelance)


Links:

'3D Consequences' Project.

Video about Anarkik 3D Design and 3D printing by Artist Farah Bandookwala.

What is haptics and 3D printing?    

Falcon haptic device. 

Anarkik3D's Pinterest Boards (includes CEO’s CEO's own work as a jeweller).  

3DPrintShow, 7 – 9th November 2013.

_______________________________________________________________

Details of all of our perks: 

We do have a lot of perks and this is great way to do market research, find out what is popular and generate awareness of Anarkik3D's product's capability.

Perk 1. £10 or more (approx. $15.50/ €11.82) You just love what we are doing and want to do your bit for us. Very special thanks. You will have our gratitude and your generosity will be noted for all to see, if we may, on our website. 

_______________________________________________________________

Image: For perk no. 2. ('DIY') and 3: 3D printed objects in 'strong, white and flexible' polyamide material

Perk 2. £15 or more (approx. $23.30/ €17.73) You just love the concept of 3D printing, want a 3D model to experience getting it printed yourself or doing it yourself – ‘DIY’. Please choose a model from the images for Perk 2 and in November 2013 we will email you the .stl file. This is for your personal use. Please respect our design rights under a Creative Commons Licence to credit the design to Anarkik3D and to not reproduce it commercially without permission and royalty agreement. 

(We will be adding more objects for ‘DIY’). 

Perk 2A. Globe: ‘DIY’ object for getting 3D printing yourself. This becomes a most romantic gift when fitted with an LED tealight. Size: 7.1 w x 6.6 d x 7.2 h ( 2.8 w x 2.6 d x 2.8 h) 

Perk 2B. Lacy Anarkik 3D Design pendant with smaller object captured inside! (supply your own chain). ‘DIY’ (but for Perk 3 we print it for you). Size cm: 4.4 w x 4.1 d x 2.9 h (1.7 w x 1.6 d x 1.1 h). 

Perk 2C. This sphere has 2 further lattice spheres inside it making it an intriguing gift as either a key ring or pendant. ‘DIY’ (but for Perk 3 we print it for you). Size: 4.24 w x 3.76 d x 3.74 h (1.669 w x 1.48 d x 1.472 h). 

Perk 2D. ‘Spiky’ Globe, ‘DIY’. Fits over an LED tealight.

_______________________________________________________________

Perk 3. £20 or more (approx. $31/ €23.63) You have probably seen and heard a lot about the ready availability of 3D printing, and how this can give us all the capability to make objects that previously we could not have done. You will receive this limited edition 3D designed and 3D printed key fob/pendant (with 2 further lattice spheres inside) or a lacy 3D pendant with another smaller part enclosed (please supply own chain) in strong white polyamide material that can be dyed. This perk includes package and posting within the UK, EU, US and Canada. For the rest of the World, add £6.76/$10.50. As this Perk will be sent direct to you from the 3D printing service company, this perk does not include VAT, sales/import tax which might be payable on delivery where there is a charge. Expected delivery: December 2013. 

Perk 3B. Lacy Anarkik 3D Design pendantwith smaller object captured inside! (supply your own chain). Size cm: 4.4 w x 4.1 d x 2.9 h (1.7 w x 1.6 d x 1.1 h). 

Perk 3A. This sphere has 2 further lattice spheres inside it making it an intriguing gift as either a key ring or pendant. Size: 4.24 w x 3.76 d x 3.74 h (1.669 w x 1.48 d x 1.472 h).

_____________________________________________________________

Perk 4. £30 or more. (approx. $47/ €35.45) You will receive a signed copy of CEO Ann Marie Shillito's book “Digital Crafts: Industrial Technologies for Applied Artists and Designer Makers” due for publication on 10 October 2013 (priced on Amazon at £23.74/$36.87/€28). Those people who have seen advance copies are giving it very favourable reviews. This perk includes package and posting within the UK. For EU add £4.50/€5.32 For US, Canada and the Rest of the World, add £8/$12.50 Expected delivery: November 2013. 

Image: Perks 4 and 5. Ann Marie Shillito's book “Digital Crafts: Industrial Technologies for Applied Artists and Designer Makers”

_______________________________________________________________

Perk 5.  £40 or more(approx. $62.25/ €47.27) you will receive a signed copy of “Digital Crafts” with a personalised message as you request (max. 25 words). This perk includes package and posting within the UK. For EU add £4.50/€5.32 For US, Canada and the Rest of the World, add £8/$12.50 Expected delivery: November 2013. 

Image: Contents page of Ann Marie Shillito's book “Digital Crafts: Industrial Technologies for Applied Artists and Designer Makers”

_______________________________________________________________

 Perk 6. £60 or more (approx. $93/€71) 

Image: Perks 6.and 7. Digital images of choice of 3D printed ceramic espresso cups and 3 bases to hold your dunking biscuit or sugarcube!

You will receive one of 3 special limited edition 3D printed objects that we have created: 

~ a ceramic espresso coffee cup (69.1 x 70.6 mm [2.7 x 2.78]) with your choice of handle and choice of colour from the chart below.

~ ceramic deskthingie( this perk has been removed from the list. Sorry.) 

~ the lacy pendant (see Perk 2B), 3D printed in steel or gold plated one (please supply own chain or cord). 

Or you may wish to have all three. 

Image: Perk 6. espresso cups, bases. The 'Deskthingie' has been removed as a perk)

 If you want a unique quirky base for your espresso cup please select one and choose your colour (see chart below) and add £40 (approx. $62.25/ €47.27) to your order: 

 Standard base 1. for espresso coffee cup. 

Base 2. to hold your sugar cube. 

 Base 3 to hold your biscuit. 

If you want your cup with an initial handle please give us the initials (max. 3), choose colour and add £15 (approx. $23.30/ €17.73) to your order. This perk includes package and posting within the UK and EU. For US/Canada add £3.67/$5.70 per item. For the Rest of the World, add £10.50/$16.34 per item. This perk does not include the VAT, sales/import tax which might be payable on delivery where there is a charge. Expected delivery: December 2013. 

Image: Colour chart for 3D printed espresso cups and bases, and for 'non edible' deskthingie.

_______________________________________________________________

Perk 7.  £100 or more (approx. $155/€118). You will receive customised versions of one of the two special limited edition objects that we have created: 

~ an espresso coffee cup with initialled handle and with your choice of colour and base: 1. a standard one, 2. to hold your sugar cube, 3. to hold your biscuit, 

Image: Perk 7. 3D printed ceramic espresso coffee cup with choice of base, in your choice of colour (see chart above).   (The 'Deskthingies', has been removed as a perk)

This perk includes package and posting within the UK. For EU add £4.50/€5.32 per item. For US, Canada and the Rest of the World, add £8/$12.50 per item. This perk does not include the VAT, sales/import tax which might be payable on delivery where there is a charge. Expected delivery: December 2013/January 2014. 

_______________________________________________________________

Perk 8. £462 or more(approx. $720/€550). Serious 2 day comprehensive course on 3D modelling and designing for 3D printing, on mutually convenient date in early 2014, with max 4 persons in the class (organise this as a group, or attend as an individual), plus a signed, personalised copy of the book 'Digital Crafts'. The courses, conducted in English, are taught by Ann Marie Shillito, MDesRCA, who has many years experience teaching design, jewellery and metalwork at degree level at UK Art Colleges. 

_______________________________________________________________

Perk 9. £500 or more (approx. $779/€594). You will receive the Anarkik 3D Design package: Cloud 9 design software, Falcon haptic device. This perk includes shipping but excludes VAT/duties & fee of approx £44.05/€52 on Falcon (less in US) and payable on delivery. Plus a personalised signed copy of the book “Digital Crafts” so this perk includes package and posting within the UK for the book. For EU add £4.50/€5.32. For US, Canada and the Rest of the World, add £8/$12.50 Expected delivery: December 2013.

If you take this perk with Anarkik 3D Design package, please go to our website and check that your computer/laptop is the right specification and has a reasonably good graphic card. It is your responsibility to check this.

A very successful IndieGoGo crowdfunding project is to your advantage as it means we can start on refinements to our software for an even better design experience. This is a priority for Anarkik3D so if you purchase Anarkik 3D Design now you will receive all the updates to version 2.1 that we manage to achieve within the extra funding. So help us be very very successful and get the word out!

_______________________________________________________________

Perk 10. £500 or more (approx. $779/ €594). Four of you can share in the fun experience of a one day tuition course, conducted in English, at Ann Marie’s personal studio in beautiful Edinburgh on a mutually convenient date in early 2014. The courses are taught by Ann Marie Shillito, MDesRCA. 

_______________________________________________________________

Perk 11. £600 or more (approx. $935/ €713). You will have seen from the video and the image above the wedding ring that Ann Marie made for Kari, her daughter. We are offering a truly special opportunity to produce a limited edition of three rings made also in 3D printed titanium with 3 interchangeable polyamide centre pieces (two of the actual centres are slightly different from those in the image – more solid and 3D printable!). This perk includes package and posting within the UK. For EU add £4.50/€5.32, for US, Canada and the Rest of the World, add £8/$12.50 Expected delivery: January/February 2014. 

Image: Perk 11. 3D printed titanium with 3 interchangeable polyamide centre pieces (actual parts are similar but different due to 3D printing constraints at this scale).

_______________________________________________________________

Perk 12. £1550 or more (approx. $2416/ €1842). You can enjoy the big bundle package, which includes the Anarkik 3D Design package (Cloud9 software and Falcon haptic device), 2 days tuition with Ann Marie (course conducted in English) and full subsistence including 3 night’s accommodation in Ann Marie’s home in beautiful Edinburgh on a mutually convenient date in early 2014. The perk includes shipping of the Falcon direct to you but does not includes VAT/duties and fee of approx £44.05/€52 on the Falcon (less in US), and payable on delivery. 

If you take this perk with Anarkik 3D Design package, please go to our website and check that your computer/laptop is the right specification and has a reasonably good graphics card.

Please also read the note below Perk 9 for a very good reason to help us be very very successful by shouting about our project and getting the word out. Success beyond our target means you will receive all the updates to version 2.1 that we manage to achieve within the extra funding. That makes for an even better 3D modelling experience.

_______________________________________________________________

range of 3D printed models, for travel and accommodation, etc, for at least 4
people, and to produce the range of perks which we hope will attract you to
support us to do this, is £10000. If we can raise more, this can help us to
attend more shows and initiate fun, educational projects to spread the word and
awareness more extensively.

Can you,
will you help us?
If you would
like to support us and don’t want a perk your generous donation of £10 (Perk 1) will go even
further than you know in helping us towards our goal!
What we can
offer in return for donations is a range of great perks. Please scroll down for details and options on each perk:

~ 3D models (designed using
Anarkik 3D Design) for you to get 3D printed: ‘DIY’ (Perk 2: models A, B,
C or D)
~ 3D printed objects designed
using Anarkik 3D Design (Perk 3: models A or B, Perk 6:
models B – G and 1 – 3), and the option for personalising two of them with
initials (Perk
7).
~ signed copies of Ann Marie
Shillito`s book, “Digital Crafts : Industrial Technologies for applied artists
and designer makers” * (Perk 4, and Perk 5 - personalised), published on 10th October.
~ 2 day comprehensive course
on 3D modelling and designing for 3D printing (Perk 8).
~ Anarkik 3D Design package
(software bundled with a Falcon haptic device) (Perk 9).
~ fun 1 day package for up to
4 people using Anarkik 3D Design to 3D model (Perk 10).
~ special limited edition rings
(3 only) in 3D printed titanium(Perk 11).
~ a big bundle package
(Anarkik 3D Design plus 3 day course for 1 or 2 people) (Perk 12).
* Ann Marie Shillito`s book,
“Digital Crafts : Industrial Technologies for applied artists and designer
makers” is about how designer makers are already accessing and using digital
technologies. The book is both inspirational, with 200 colour images of work,
and useful with information about the different technologies and what you need
to know to get access to them.
Background 
Anarkik 3D Design as a 3D modelling system grew out of founder
Ann Marie Shillito`s vision for a way of working and designing digitally in 3D,
more attuned to designer makers’ needs and methods of working,offering a way around the barriers
presented by traditional, standard computer aided design packages. Makers think
and do in 3D so Anarkik 3D Design works this way.





Image: Haptic - the sense of touch - how do you get across the
sensation of actually touching a virtual object other than physically
experiencing this?
It is this that is so special about Anarkik 3D Design: the use of
3D haptics and physically moving your hand in 3 dimensions, in x, y and z axes.
Haptics means 'touch' and a Falcon haptic device provides not only the
capability to touch and feel in 3D, to feel the process of modelling, shaping
and constructing,  you also more easily move
and navigate within your virtual 3D work space and ‘know’ where you are. This makes
Anarkik 3D Design very accessible, easy to learn and enjoyable to use. It looks
strange and the sensation is strange - but only for a very short
time because it taps into how we naturally interact with 3 dimensional
things in the real world.
Affordable, and easy to learn and use, Anarkik 3D Design offers the
means to produce unique, customised and innovatory items and jewellery. 




Image: 3D printed rings from designs by jeweller Birgit Laken using
her Anarkik 3D Design package, her perk through our crowdfunding campaign in
2012.
Access to 3D printing technology gives the capability and the
capacity to produce in a diverse range of materials including precious metals,
such as titanium, gold and silver, as well as ceramics, steel, nylon, bronze,
composites, glass, plastics and even chocolate. 
As an example of what is possible, one of the most treasured
things that Ann Marie created is the wedding ring in titanium that her eldest
daughter Kari wanted so much, as featured below. The wedding ring and the
interlocking engagement ring were designed, in consultation with Kari, using our
Anarkik 3D Design software system, then prototypes were 3D printed to test for
fit, and finally the wedding ring was 3D printed in titanium.





How is this affordable?
Anarkik 3D Design costs £600 (approx $900/€700). This is a bundle
price for both software (Cloud9) and the Falcon haptic device and can be bought
from our company’s distributors or direct as a special offer from us only during
this crowdfunding project. 
You can also buy your own 3D printer – prices can be as low as
£700 – or as we also do, use commercial web-based 3D printing companies for a
professional service and much wider range of 3D printing materials.  
About Anarkik3D Ltd: the Team: 
Ann Marie Shillito: Anarkik3D founder and CEO

Software development and
management: 
Xiaoqing Cao: Anarkik3D founder and
haptics consultant 
Qi Ma: software consultant re software
development and support 
Alex Shaw: technical
manager/developer (freelance) 
Elizabeth Armour:Anarkik 3D Design product
presenter for 3DPrintShow (freelance)


Links:
'3D Consequences' Project.
Video about Anarkik 3D Design and 3D printing by Artist Farah Bandookwala.
What is haptics and 3D printing?    
Falcon haptic device. 
Anarkik3D's Pinterest Boards (includes CEO’s CEO's own work as a jeweller).  
3DPrintShow, 7 – 9th November 2013.

and this is great way to do market research, find out what is popular and generate awareness of Anarkik3D's product's capability.

story:
Short Summary

Let's learn about 3D printing firsthand by designing and printing 3D models with our very own FlashForge Creator X 3D Printer

Please educate yourself about this particular model and decide if this is something you are interested in. The amazon link is listed below.

http://www.amazon.com/FlashForge-Printer-New-Model-Structure/dp/B00I8NM6JO/ref=sr_1_4?ie=UTF8&qid=1398219316&sr=8-4&keywords=3d+printer

Time lapse videos of the printer we would like to buy.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PpkNJw9JFpU

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lz7ucAlmSWo

Review Video

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TE249Ib07KY


What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • We need $1300 to buy a FlashForge Creator X 3D Printer. This new model has an improved build plate and metal frame.
  • We need another $100 for a few spools of PLA and ABS plastic to get started.

The Risks

Unknown durability and the printer may break down on the first print

PLA and ABS Material cost 

Availability of Printer

We have to figure out how to divide material costs. Open for suggestion.

story:
The New Nine

We’ve combined the best features of much more expensive printers – and engineered design innovations that bring you a great price on a super-fast, scalable, commercial quality 3D printer. Think of  it this way - you're getting Ferrari performance using Honda parts.

  • 100% complete kit – everything you need is included.
  • True innovation – including never seen before technology.
  • Quality components – all industrial grade.
  • Proven reliable components you can compare to printers 10X the price.

Take a look below – and let us know what questions you have!

 

We Geeked Out on Innovation

The New Nine is 2X faster than any comparably priced printer for sure, and faster than printers that are thousands of dollars. And its rugged! We are working on a project that requires each New Nine to print for 21 hours straight – and they perform flawlessly! We'll update with video's of the project soon. Here’s some reasons why it’s fast and maintains quality:

  • The Tuned Mass Damper – our patent pending damper is tuned to remove wiggle.
  • Deducted fan design increases speed and reduces imperfections.
  • We engineered the heck out of it – combining geeky innovation stuff and best of breed designs.
  • It delivers amazing print quality - take a look !

Solid as a Rock

The New Nine was born from our passion – 3D printing and teaching others about it. We were just not happy with the speed, performance, and reliability of printers we could afford, like Prusa models. So we started from scratch, and made a printer we were proud to own, proud to sell, and proud to educate our students with. The New Nine has:

  • Innovative Counterbalanced X Axis design.
  • Great cable management system.
  • Scalable, Open Frame you can customize to any size.
  • Industrial Grade Steel Tensioned Structure design
  • And much more

 

Delivering Betas Now. Shipping in December.

We're delivering a bunch of Beta's in Seattle now, and using New Nines for customer projects. We will start shipping on a First to Order, First to Receive basis in the beginning of December.

 

Risks & Challenges

Honestly, any project has inherent risks and challenges. The good news is that we are currently delivering printers to the local Seattle market for our Teach and Keep™ educational tutoring program. Doing this makes us very confident we can get through any obstacles that may arise.

Outside of unforeseen circumstances, everyone at Easily Build is fully committed to delivering an amazing product, on time.

We have expertise in manufacturing, sourcing, supply chain management, IT, engineering, accounting, and all the necessary disciplines in order to succeed. There will be challenges, but we will devote 120% efforts to minimize any disruptions, to communicate openly and honestly when they do, and solve them as soon as possible.

story:
The Social Enterprise with a Difference

20 for Society is a Singapore-based social enterprise that was created with the aim to influence consumerism behavior to have a greater positive contribution to society. Here at 20 for Society, we design, build and produce lifestyle products.

When you buy from 20 for Society,

20% of the Price goes directly to Humanitarian Aid and Charity.

Each project’s total sales and contribution to the beneficiaries are updated on our website and Facebook. No gimmicks, no caveats.

We are introducing this business model that is designed around our mantra, Society First, Profit Second. With your support, we will provide socially responsible lifestyle products to the world and create a society that helps.



Notebook20 - Our First Project

(Limited Edition, 5000 copies worldwide)

Our everyday companion little black book. Built for work and play, the Notebook20 is both compact and stylish.

Notebook20’s best features:

  • Compact portability (128mm x 186mm, slightly smaller than A5 size)


  • Share your notes with perforated pages


  • Additional back pocket for cards and such


  • Quality 100gsm, acid-free paper


  • Durable “soft touch” hardcover



Designed in Singapore, our first project aims to help children with cancer, supporting them and their families(*).

When you carry a 20 for Society product, you support the vision of socially responsible consumption.

Furthermore, every 20 for Society project is a Limited Edition item. For our first project, we will only be selling 5000 copies of Notebook20 worldwide, after which the same item/design will never be produced by us again.


*Who is the Beneficiary?

We are not a charity fund raiser for any particular set of charities. 20 for Society is a social enterprise which adopts a revolutionary business model of giving back 20% of the company’s sales to society.

We currently do not name the specific beneficiary before the end of the project due to strict requirements and overheads in Singapore on fund raising for certain named charities. You can see how much funds we have raised through this Indiegogo campaign page, and verify the 20% give back to charity on our Website and Facebook page!

We will also share snippets of our target beneficiaries. For example, the Notebook20 project will see its 20% contribution go towards helping children with cancer.

Please follow us on our website and Facebook. Once each project is completed, we will update the name of the beneficiary, and show you how your support has made society a better place! We will also conduct periodic surveys to get a better understanding of which communities you would like to see us support.


What We Need & What You Get

We need your support to help us produce the Notebook20. With additional funds, we can prepare for more projects within this year.

Together, we can show the world that a socially responsible business model is sustainable, and take the first step in driving change  in consumerism.


The Perks!

We are including a companion bookmark for each book if you get the Family Ambassador perks. We promise it will be a nice surprise!
We will need at least $20,000 (or 1000 books sold) in minimum funding to go through with this project. Our stretch target is to raise $100,000 (all 5000 books sold), which would mean a much greater 20% contribution to our beneficiary that helps children with cancer, supporting them and their families. Also, if we achieve our stretch targets, we will disclose our upcoming projects and bring them to market even sooner!

One of our biggest challenges is in offering international shipping - a problem many similar product projects face. The Notebook20 is a hefty and solid notebook and shipping it via airmail/courier will be very expensive. We rather not make our supporters pay an additional US$10-15 per book for shipping that will go fully to postal/courier companies. As such, we offer free international sea/surface but highlight the shipping information and risk:

*** IMPORTANT SHIPPING INFORMATION ***

FREE Worldwide Shipping Included. Delivery to any country outside of Singapore  will be via sea/surface mail. This means that:

  1. Shipping outside of Singapore may take up to 2 - 3 months to reach you.
  2. There is no tracking and insurance for your shipment.


Risks & Challenges

Having already designed and produced our drafts for the Notebook20, we are confident that we can deliver on our promises. It is conceivable that there may be some time-delay risks in the manufacturing of Notebook20 and logistics, but these are not expected to be show stoppers.

Having already worked with our manufacturing partners on prototyping, we believe they have the ability to produce the Notebook20 to our specifications.

We will keep all our supporters updated on the progress of our work, from when every minute detail is finalised, to manufacturing and delivery.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot help us financially, that is no problem too! Help us further our vision by liking/sharing our website, Facebook and this Indiegogo page with your friends and family!


FAQs

1. How is your company different from a lot of other companies who donate a token sum of product sales to charity as part of their CSR?

We consistently contribute 20% of every sale to the underserved. Other companies do conduct CSR activities which contribute sales proceeds to charity but these are performed occasionally and ad-hoc. We believe giving back to society is a good thing, and good things should be done consistently.

We have set one of the highest percentage (20% of all company sales) that we know of for consistent ongoing contribution to society. Giving back is at the core of 20 for Society, and our business model demonstrates that.

2. How do you know that your model of giving 20 percent revenue is operationally sustainable?

As with all businesses exploring uncharted waters, we have done the paper planning and homework, and are satisfied that this model can work out. All that's left is for us to materialise it and prove that it is realistic and sustainable. This is a key milestone on our journey towards influencing other companies to adopt similar business models.

3. How can shoppers be assured that the funds really reach the beneficiaries as promised?

Customer trust is the foundation upon which our business is built. There are two parts to this question (1) Ensuring the funds reach the selected beneficiary and (2) Ensuring that the beneficiaries have used the funds appropriately to help the underserved.

Our founders and staff will be following through with each contribution and be personally involved. We will be on the ground together with our beneficiaries delivering the help needed. Our supporters can catch all these updates on our Facebook and Website. We even welcome you to come along if you wish to help!

4. How is this different from me making a direct donation to charities?

If you do not have a need for a product, we encourage you to make the direct donation!

The goal of 20 for Society is to transform consumerism. Therefore, we provide socially responsible product alternatives to consumers so that they can have a choice when they need lifestyle products.

If you do not have a need to consume a product, then making a direct donation is awesome! Keep it up!

5. Are you just trying to profiteer by using these charities to appeal to consumers?

Every business has to make profits - it allows a business to sustain itself, its employees and produce necessary goods and services for the betterment of society. What is important, and this applies to people as much as companies, is that we must create a positive impact from what we do.

At 20 for Society, it is crucial that we produce a positive impact on everyone who supports and works with us: Customers fulfill their needs while helping others. Our company is able to provide fair wages and increase job opportunities. Our beneficiaries are able to help more of those who deserve help with more funding and resources.

Contributing to society is as important to us as growing the company. 20% of the entire company's sales goes to charities and humanitarian organizations. We do this because giving back is at the core of 20 for Society.
story_txt:
The Social Enterprise with a Difference
20 for Society is a Singapore-based 
social enterprise that was created with the aim to influence consumerism
 behavior to have a greater positive contribution to society. Here at 20
 for Society, we design, build and produce lifestyle products.



When you buy from 20 for Society, 
20% of the Price goes directly to Humanitarian Aid and Charity. 

Each project’s total sales and 
contribution to the beneficiaries are updated on our website and 
Facebook. No gimmicks, no caveats.



We are introducing this business model that is designed around our mantra, Society First, Profit Second. With your support, we will provide socially responsible lifestyle products to the world and create a society that helps.


Notebook20 - Our First Project
(Limited Edition, 5000 copies worldwide)




Our everyday companion little black book. Built for work and play, the Notebook20 is both compact and stylish.
Notebook20’s best features:
Compact portability (128mm x 186mm, slightly smaller than A5 size)



Share your notes with perforated pages



Additional back pocket for cards and such



Quality 100gsm, acid-free paper



Durable “soft touch” hardcover




Designed in Singapore, our first project aims to help children with cancer, supporting them and their families(*).
When you carry a 20 for Society product, you support the vision of socially responsible consumption.
Furthermore, every 20 for Society project is a Limited Edition item. For our first project, we will only be selling 5000 copies of Notebook20 worldwide, after which the same item/design will never be produced by us again.

*Who is the Beneficiary?

We are not a charity fund raiser for any particular set of charities. 20
for Society is a social enterprise which adopts a revolutionary business model
of giving back 20% of the company’s sales to society.
We currently do not name the
specific beneficiary before the end of the project due
to strict requirements and overheads in Singapore on fund raising for certain
named charities. You can see how much funds we have raised through this Indiegogo campaign page, and verify the 20% give back to charity on our Website and Facebook page! 
We will also share snippets of our target beneficiaries.
For example, the Notebook20 project will see its 20% contribution go towards
helping children with cancer.Please follow us on our website and Facebook.
 Once each project
is completed, we will update the name of the beneficiary, and show you how your
support has made society a better place! We will also conduct periodic surveys
to get a better understanding of which communities you would like to see us
support.

What We Need & What You Get

We need your support to help us produce the Notebook20. With additional funds, we can prepare for more projects within this year.Together, we can show the world that a socially responsible business model is sustainable, and take the first step in driving change  in consumerism.
The Perks!






We are including a companion bookmark for each book if you get the Family Ambassador perks. We promise it will be a nice surprise!We will need at least $20,000 (or 1000 books sold) in minimum funding to go through with this project. Our stretch target is to raise $100,000 (all 5000 books sold), which would mean a much greater 20% contribution to our beneficiary that helps children with cancer, supporting them and their families. Also, if we achieve our stretch targets, we will disclose our upcoming projects and bring them to market even sooner!One of our biggest challenges is in offering international shipping - a problem many similar product projects face. The Notebook20 is a
 hefty and solid notebook and shipping it via airmail/courier will be 
very expensive. We rather not make our supporters pay an additional 
US$10-15 per book for shipping that will go fully to postal/courier 
companies. As such, we offer free international sea/surface but highlight the shipping information and risk:*** IMPORTANT SHIPPING INFORMATION ***
FREE Worldwide Shipping Included. Delivery to any country outside of Singapore  will be via sea/surface mail. This means that:

Shipping outside of Singapore may take up to 2 - 3 months to reach you.
There is no tracking and insurance for your shipment.


 Risks & Challenges
Having already designed and produced our drafts for the Notebook20, we are confident that we can deliver on our promises. It is conceivable that there may be some time-delay risks in the manufacturing of Notebook20 and logistics, but these are not expected to be show stoppers.Having already worked with our manufacturing partners on prototyping, we believe they have the ability to produce the Notebook20 to our specifications.We will keep all our supporters updated on the progress of our work, from when every minute detail is finalised, to manufacturing and delivery.Other Ways You Can Help
If you cannot help us financially, that is no problem too! Help us further our vision by liking/sharing our  website, Facebook and this Indiegogo page with your friends and family!



FAQs1. How is your company different from a lot of other companies who
donate a token sum of product sales to charity as part of their CSR?We consistently contribute 20% of every sale to the
underserved. Other companies do conduct CSR activities which contribute sales
proceeds to charity but these are performed occasionally and ad-hoc. We believe
giving back to society is a good thing,
and good things should be done consistently.
We have set one of the highest percentage (20% of all company sales)
that we know of for consistent ongoing contribution to society. Giving back is at the core of 20 for Society, and our
business model demonstrates that.2. How do you know that your model of giving 20 percent revenue is
operationally sustainable?As with all businesses exploring uncharted waters, we have done the
paper planning and homework, and are satisfied that this model can work out.
All that's left is for us to materialise it and prove that it is realistic and
sustainable. This is a key milestone on our journey towards influencing other companies to adopt similar
business models.
3. How can shoppers be assured that the funds really reach the
beneficiaries as promised?
Customer trust is the foundation
upon which our business is built. There are two parts to this question (1) Ensuring
the funds reach the selected beneficiary and (2) Ensuring that the
beneficiaries have used the funds appropriately to help the underserved.
Our founders and staff will be following through with each contribution
and be personally involved. We will be
on the ground together with our beneficiaries delivering the help needed. Our
supporters can catch all these updates on our Facebook and Website. We even
welcome you to come along if you wish to help!
4. How is this different from me making a direct donation to charities?
If you do not have a need for a product, we encourage you to make the
direct donation!
The goal of 20 for Society is to transform consumerism. Therefore, we
provide socially responsible product alternatives to consumers so that they can
have a choice when they need lifestyle products.
If you do not have a need to consume a product, then making a direct
donation is awesome! Keep it up!
5. Are you just trying to profiteer by using these charities to appeal
to consumers?
Every business has to make profits - it allows a business to sustain
itself, its employees and produce necessary goods and services for the
betterment of society. What is important, and this applies to people as much as
companies, is that we must create a positive impact from what we do.
At 20 for Society, it is crucial that we produce a positive impact on
everyone who supports and works with us:
Customers fulfill their needs while helping others. Our company is able to
provide fair wages and increase job opportunities. Our beneficiaries are able
to help more of those who deserve help with more funding and resources.
Contributing to society is as important to us as growing the company.
20% of the entire company's sales goes to charities and humanitarian
organizations. We do this because giving back is at the core of 20 for Society.

story:
Bring Adobe tools to the Linux desktop

Day after day, people ask the same questions about Adobe tools on multiple forums all over the world. People who love graphic design, website development, video compositions or just plainly enhance and sort the thousands of photographs they made.

All they want to do is to run the tools they love (and pay for) on the platform of their choice. Now they have to result to clumsy solutions like booting virtual machines, dual booting to another OS or run very specific half-working setups using Wine.

This project aims to change all that. We should have out-of-the-box installation and native running of the latest version of all the software in Creative Cloud on Linux desktop systems.

How will you do that?

Unless Adobe is willing to release native binaries for the Linux platform the only other way of running applications natively is by using Wine to emulate Microsoft Windows. In fact, a lot of Adobe tools already run well when using Wine but there are usually limitations lurking right around the corner. People who have dabbled with this will know what I am talking about.

The objective of this project is to improve the situation by getting paid development done on the Wine project which is the only real way to get things done according to our wishes. The development will have to comply to the Wine development standards and changes need to be accepted to the Wine repository.

The funds will be completely spent on setting up development and contributing to the Wine code base. The amount is estimated on having one full-time developer working on this for a period of 2 years. This is a reasonable amount of time to get real results while not stretching the goals too far.

Updates on development will be shared with contributors by means of blog posts, social media, ... to be set up after the launch of the project.

Some numbers

Here are some numbers that convinced me creating this project:

  • Googling Adobe Linux gives you 50 billion results
  • This thread on getsatisfaction.com got almost 16000 votes before it was closed. The follow-up thread adds another 600 votes to the tally.
  • The Wine appdb contains hundreds of reports ranging from garbage to platinum quality. But most of them are garbage, especially if you look at newer versions.
  • There are currently 150 bugs open related to Adobe in Wine's bug database

Who is Jimmy?

You are! Or rather, anyone who wants the freedom to choose the operating system of their choice. Jimmy McDraw is just an idea, an average guy or girl who loves what he or she does and doesn't want to be hindered by imposed limitations.

So embrace the Jimmy in you!

What if Adobe decides to launch a native version?

I hope they do!

However I doubt they will. They have been steadily withdrawing support for the few tools (Reader, Flash Player, ...) they do have Linux versions for. In the getsatisfaction.com thread I referred to earlier an official representative said over four years ago that Linux support was now most definitely on the radar of the development team.

It does not take 4 years for a company like Adobe to release a Linux version of their software especially given the fact that they already support another Unix-based system. This means that the decision to not do it is for business reasons and they do not see Linux as a viable platform. It is a chicken and egg problem.

Even if they decide to launch a native version this development will benefit the Wine and OSS community greatly and running the Windows version of this very complex software provides some excellent test cases for the Wine community.

So if you're not Jimmy, who are you?

My name is Mathy Vanvoorden. I have been a software developer, project engineer and team leader of a group of software engineers in a major company for over 8 years now. My main focus is on C++ development, improving software quality and Linux. My favourite Linux distribution has been Gentoo for many years now.

In my free time I like to dabble with graphic design, photography and video composition which is why I have a subscription to the Creative Cloud suite.

If you're an OSS fan, why not use OSS software?

I do! I use Gimp, Inkscape, Audacity and many others on a regular basis. However, for complete projects I still prefer the Adobe suite, and there are many like me. For video editing I have not found a suitable alternative yet. It also doesn't help if clients or suppliers specifically ask for Adobe file formats.

How did you make the movie?

Using a Wacom tablet, Adobe Illustrator and After Effects. Running in Windows 7. Running inside KVM. On a Gentoo based KDE desktop.


This is great, how can I help?

Well, first of all by contributing to the campaign. If you are unable to help financially you can still help by spreading the word:

  • Follow Jimmy's Twitter account for updates
  • Use #IWantMyCC to make your voice heard
  • Share this campaign with friends, family and anyone else you think might be interested.
  • Be awesome and never stop using Linux

Be awesome and never stop using Linux

story:
Who am I?

I am glad you asked! Think innovator, motivator, navigator...yep that's me, Titus Blair. Ever since I was a wee-lad I have been creating cool computer creations and I have been lucky to be a part of the internet and mobile revolutions.  What an awesome adventure! I have realized what I love most in life is to help others achieve freedom!  With the advent of mobile apps there has never been a better time in history to make this a reality for so many people and my goal is to help you achieve your own FREEDOM!

What is the 24 Hour App Business - App-U-Mentary?

Think reality show combined with a documentary and you have the 24 Hour App Business. It's the world's first ever App-U-Mentary.  What does that mean? It means that when you watch the 24 Hour App Business you will learn everything it takes to design, develop, publish and market a REAL mobile application...and you don't have to be a coder or designer!  You accompany me as I go through all the steps of making an app business in REAL TIME.

Where will I be able to access it?

The course will be available online at www.SmallSuccess.com and also via android and apple mobile devices when it has been completed.

When will it be available?

In addition to the 24 hours spent to make the App-U-Mentary I will need time to do the production and editing of the course and setup the website.  Given the time it takes to complete those tasks I have  scheduled to complete and release the course by the end of April.

Why Indiegogo?

I love the idea of Indiegogo and how many people and ideas have achieved freedom through it's digital doors.  It is my dream to complete this App-U-Mentary and make it available to as many people as possible. I need your help Indiegogoers!  By backing my idea you will allow me to fund the development, production and marketing of the course.  Most importantly you will help make my dream a reality with your support and feedback.  

Costs Breakdown

To make this course possible I need to raise funds which will be used for the following:

$2,000 - The production, editing and design of the course.

$1,750 - The web and mobile application development to support the course.

$750 - The marketing of the course.
