story:
Our Story

Boss Dog Games is a company that our family started during the pandemic.

A funny joke quickly became our very first game, and with that, started a mission to make people laugh.

Our mission is to create a gaming company that isn't all about profits- its about making people smile. Our second game, Beware of Bears is continuing that mission. Since our company was created during the pandemic by a family of five, we realize sometimes all a family needs is a good laugh. That's why we're donating x1 game for every x1 sold after our campaign to kids in hospitals across the country. Every new game we create allows us to spread more joy and laughs! 

Our first game, Farting Frenchies has continued to be a great success and since launching the initiative June, we've donated 1,600 games to kids in hospitals across the country!
 

The new game that has everyone laughing

Our second game, Beware of Bears is continuing our mission to make people laugh!

Beware of Bears is an exciting fast-paced card game where players fight to sabotage and eliminate each other while watching out for... bears! Defeat your friends and make your path to victory before you end up in a bear's stomach! ??

The more you progress through the game, the crazier it gets with lava, evil squirrels, yummy donuts, and best of all, scary bears! Beware of Bears is a super strategic, family friendly, fast paced, 20-30 minute game that will keep you laughing... and running for your life!
 

More About the Game:

 


 

What you'll get by sponsoring our project:

  • Choose from different reward levels
  • All reward levels include exclusive extras & stretch goals items that will not be available after the first production run



The Impact

Our Mission:

  • To create a gaming company that isn't all about profits- it's about making people smile.
  • Every new game we create allows us to spread more joy and laughs! After the campaign is final, we'll have a new game to add to our mission and give back.

Help us bring this project to life:

  • With the funds raised from the campaign we'll be working on manufacturing as well as upgrading the game with fun additions to make it the best it can be!
  • We'll also reinvest into the business so we can continue to bring more bring smiles to tables across the country.


     


Beware of Bears Origin Story

It all came from a trip... to the woods. We live in CT, pretty far from bear country, so when we went for a hike one day and came upon a “Beware of Bears” sign we were surprised...aaaand had a good laugh...See, one member of the family, who shall remain nameless, (pssst rhymes with icky) has a habit of falling into haaaaiiiry situations while on trips. We all laughed that chances are he’d be the one to get caught by a bear. 

The backstory: rewind to 2017 when we went on a trip to L.A. to film for Shark Tank. The day before we went on set, Mickey took a tumble off an electric scooter, got four stitches and two fractured wrists! After insisting he was fiiiiine, (Brave kid!) the very next day Mickey went head-to-head with nature again- a SHARK named Mr. Wonderful! 

Fast forward to 2019; we’re on a trip, yet again, and Mickey gets stung by the third most dangerous jellyfish in the world-- a Portugese Man O War, aaaand, thank goodness, lives to tell the tale. See, nature and trips do not end well for Mickey!

So that’s why we had a good laugh...aaanand spent the rest of the hike talking about how it would make a hilarious game! We went home and immediately created the game. That game is 98% the exact same game to this day.

That infamous day:

Hi! We’re the Naqvi’s.  We’re passionate about family, pets, the great outdoors...and games! Like many business owners, our small business took a back seat during quarantine, so we filled our days creating and playing games. We wanted to bring that same joy to others so we decided to give it a go and create the gaming company you see today! Our first game, Farting Frenchies was a huge success so we pivoted and created a gaming company that the whole family has a hand in! We’ve had so much fun ever since!

Being a family of entrepreneurs, designers & artists really helps! Family walks around the neighborhood are now brainstorming sessions and time after dinner is spent drawing and revising our games. It’s been a blast! Please help us create this game and back our project! 

We guarantee you’ll also enjoy a TON of laughs if you do!

 

 

read the full review here

read the full review here

This game has been play-tested like crazy by some of the best in the biz and families alike, and we’re so excited that it’s gotten such amazing reviews. Gamers love the dual action gameplay and how players have to keep an eye on their opponent at all times. Gamers who play long games and short ones alike loved the feel and the flow of the game!

A HUUUGE Thank You to all those amazing people who have given feedback, played-tested the game, and the few who have watched the game go from iteration to iteration. It has been an amazing journey! 

Backers- by backing this game, you'll help us put the first edition of Beware of Bears into production!

 

Risks & Challenges

The toughest thing with a new product is working out all the details, but we’re lucky enough that we've done this before! Also, our other gig is in product development and graphic design- so we have all the tools we need to deliver the game- and do it fast! Our factory is ready and we already have the base game artwork finalized and ready to print! As soon as the campaign is complete we’ll be placing the order and getting it into production

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, but like what we're doing and still want to help:

  • Get the word out and make some noise about the campaign on social 
  • insta/tiktok: @bossdoggames
  • FB: @bossdoggamesco
  • It's easy- you can even share using the Indiegogo share tools!

Thank you so much for all your support.

❤️ The whole Fam!

Amanda, Hamza, Mickey, Ayaan, Sofia, and our pups Ace & Zara ❤️

story:
Welcome to Crown of the Oathbreaker! 

>>> Pre-orders are available at Elderbrain.com <<<

Crown of the Oathbreaker is a D&D 5e compatible dark adventure campaign taking characters from levels 5 to 12. The story is set in multi-layered sandbox realms, in which the players will uncover dark secrets from the past of a royal family after the fall of a blessed era and break a curse that plagues the kingdom.

 

The cursed Crown of Azennar

 

The players will have to explore lands ravaged by the curse and travel to the Feyrealm, the Shadowrealm, and even Hell, where they will face hard moral dilemmas before saving the crown from the dreadful effects of an otherwise inevitable pact. A sinister bargain has caused suffering for the people of the land and has created a mad witch-knight hungering for revenge.

The adventure is partially set in Aglarion, a blossoming kingdom where all intelligent races are part of society and live in tolerance. This means that players can choose to play exotic monstrous races and still function effectively throughout the adventure. 

 

Download the 10-page Adventure Summary booklet to learn every detail of the complete campaign background and the storyline of each chapter. SPOILER ALERT! The summary contains massive amounts of spoilers, so don’t read it unless you plan to be the GM for this adventure module.

Krasnar Azennar, aberration infused lich-knight heir to the crown

 

Crown of the Oathbreaker is based on an elaborate survey, which had over 2000 responses from dedicated RPG fans. We took the results and created an intricately woven story that incorporates every element of the desired aspects of a great adventure as decided by the community. Thank you again if you took part in this communal effort!

You can still fill out the survey if you missed it. Your votes could shift the adventure in new directions.   

 

Caress of the Elderbrain

 

Based on the survey results, Crown of the Oathbreaker is a mix between sandbox and classic storylines, with a healthy blend of combat and non-combat encounters for all types of gameplay. It also combines elements of both high and dark fantasy, resulting in a singular style. Our approach was to come up with unique twists on classic features for every game aspect that was covered in the survey.

Here are some of the major pillars of the adventure, as decided by the voting: 

The adventure takes the players to the three most favored planar settings: the Feyrealm, the Shadowrealm, and Hell.

 

From 1 (I don't like it) to 4 (I love it) the result is clear, so the adventure features a combination of several intricately woven sandbox settings connected with some short linear storylines.

 

The archvillain is a complex recurring enemy - a hexblade oathbreaker paladin infused with the power of an entity from the far realms who eventually becomes a lich-knight.

 

Download the complete evaluation of the survey results to see how the responses to each section shaped the final adventure. 

The adventure and the campaign setting are also influenced by our community through our Discord server.  Join the discussion, add your thoughts, check out the latest content, and merge your intellect with the Elderbrain! 

We think everyone would agree that the quality of the finished product is paramount for both content and design. The community has decided and has confirmed our own love of playing long campaigns with a lot of unique monsters and NPCs. We appreciate it when such a product is heavily illustrated in color, packed with loads of maps, as well as scenes, monsters, items, and NPC illustrations. We are aiming for both the best quality and the highest possible quantity of artwork.

The midnight hags Tyke, Blister, and Splinter - the Matrons of Malice

 

Adventure module

The core product covered by our initial funding is an approximately 500-page D&D 5e compatible adventure campaign, including a 50-page Player's Guide and Campaign Setting section with a complete detailed description of the Kingdom of Aglarion, and the capital City of Onadbyr.

The core adventure module contains the following elements:

  • 5 large sandbox maps with over 100 encounter locations in each
  • 27 dungeon maps with GM and player versions
  • 36 new subclasses/archetypes, three for each base class 
  • 15 different character background options to tie characters into the setting
  • 38 adventure scene illustrations
  • 180+ NPCs, all of them with illustrated portraits 
  • 34 new unique magic items with illustrations 
  • 29 new unique illustrated monsters and 4 new monster templates 
  • 15 new spells and 13 new feats with illustrations

 

Your own customizable and upgradable huge Battle Snail mount from the Feyrealm

 

Booster cards

Hand out the illustrated magic item cards to your players when they obtain a new unique item and spare them the time otherwise wasted on taking long notes, or asking you several times about their powers or what the item looks like.

Use the monster and NPC portrait cards to show players with whom they are interacting and you will only have to flip them to see their stat block.

Each card has an illustration on one side and a descriptive text with stats on the other side.

 

All cards are 2.5” x 3.5” embossed stock cards with 11.0-pt. (280 micrometers) thickness, 320 gsm, black core card stock from German paper manufacturer Koehler, incorporating a subtle raised texture that creates air pockets for easier shuffling and dealing.

Cards are also be available in PDF format.

The 120-card Booster Pack includes the following cards:

  • NPC cards (47 cards)
  • Magic item cards (34 cards)
  • Monster cards (15 cards)
  • Spell cards (13 cards)
  • Feat cards (11 cards)

A Wand of the Mimic is a great tool to turn your couch into a vicious watchdog

 

Soundscapes

We have created the free Elderbrain Soundscapes app to bring the atmosphere of each scene to you in the most diverse way. The app is always going to be free to use with every soundscape included. 

 

Each soundscape is composed of several dozen dynamically and constantly changing sounds that each play at random times, direction, length, distance, reverb, and velocity to create an infinitely unique ambiance with no repetitions. 

The following soundscapes are already part of our live free app:

  • The City of Onadbyr 
  • The Bleak Mire 
  • King’s Games  
  • Cursed Land  
  • Undead City 
  • Undead Army 
  • Gibbering Fort 
  • Battle of the Champions 
  • Shadow Requiem 
  • Monster Menagerie 
  • Feast of the Satyr King 
  • Underdark 
  • Holy Temple 

 

We have also launched a Patreon page to support the expansion of the Soundscape app with new sounds and features, delivering a sound every month: https://www.patreon.com/elderbraincom

The Patreon is also dedicated to creating A Crown of the Oathbreaker comic book to visualize the complete story of the adventure from different points of view. One or two pages will be published every month and made available to our kind Patreon members if our goals are reached.

 

The Bulbous Observer is a massive floating abomination capable of keeping watch over large areas

 

We have created a simplified reward structure so that everyone may find the most suitable one for them. The listed prices don’t include printing and shipping costs, which will be handled and calculated at Elderbrain.com during checkout when you place your order there.

The Year of Rogue Dragons pdf, the Crown of the Oathbreaker Character Sheet pdfs, the Discord role code, and the survey link is sent in an e-mail to all new eligible backers during the first week of every month.

 

PDF Version ($20)

You will receive the complete adventure, including the Campaign Setting, and the Player’s Guide in PDF format.

 

PDF + Physical Version ($25)

You will receive the complete adventure, the Campaign Setting, and the Player’s Guide in PDF format and the ability to order the printed book from Elderbrain.com at the cost of printing and shipping.

 

PDF + Physical Version + All extras ($49) 

You will receive the complete adventure, the Campaign Setting, and the Player’s Guide in PDF format and the ability to order the printed book from Elderbrain.com at the cost of printing and shipping.

PLUS up to 120 illustrated Booster Cards

PLUS a free PDF copy of our platinum seller 100-page adventure module “Year of Rogue Dragons”

PLUS a PDF format character sheet designed for Crown of the Oathbreaker

 

All in one + Become an NPC! ($99)

You will receive the complete adventure, the Campaign Setting, and the Player’s Guide in PDF format and the ability to order the printed book from Elderbrain.com at the cost of printing and shipping.

 

PLUS up to 120 illustrated Booster Cards

PLUS a free PDF copy of our platinum seller 100-page adventure module “Year of Rogue Dragons”

PLUS a PDF format character sheet designed for Crown of the Oathbreaker

PLUS you will be immortalized as one of the NPCs in the adventure with your own likeness in their portrait! Tell us your NPC's gender/race/class/occupation/features/looks and we will insert your character into the setting.

 

103 backers who have already been turned into 103 NPCs

 

All in one + Become a main plot NPC! ($1000) 

You will receive the  PDF format and the ability to order the printed book and the Booster Cards from Elderbrain.com at the cost of printing and shipping.

PLUS up to 120 illustrated Booster Cards

PLUS a free PDF copy of our platinum seller 100-page adventure module “Year of Rogue Dragons”

PLUS a PDF format character sheet designed for Crown of the Oathbreaker

PLUS we add your fully illustrated character of choice to the storyline with a base of operations. 

We will create a specific storyline, organization, and background for a character of your choice, which also gets a full-body HD-quality illustration. We will come up with the story for your character together with you, tying him/her/them deep into the main course of the adventure. We will also create a base of operations for this character in the form of a beautiful dungeon map, which we will populate according to your preferences. Choose to be a villain or an ally of the players, a lot will depend on your imagination! 

 

We are old-time friends who grew up together and have played D&D and various other RPGs together for the past 30 or so years. We have always wanted to create shiny RPG products, which we can call our own, so we launched the Elderbrain.com site and have recently released our first D&D product, “Year of Rogue Dragons”, a 100-page adventure module for evil dragon characters set in the Forgotten Realms, which quickly became a platinum seller on DMsGuild.

It was an amazing experience to hold our own printed hardcover adventure module in our hands. The pdf version was purchased by over 1500 like-minded fans, who gave feedback, support, and so much love.

We didn’t want to stop there. So we rolled up our sleeves to create this project, and we hope you will share our excitement!

 

Authors 

Gabor (Geek 6/Game Dev 4/Manager 6) has molten dice flowing in his veins. His most frequently used feats are: Get Things Done, Motivate Others, Create From Nothing. He has been GMing and playing RPGs for over 30 years and creates computer games for a living. 

  

Tom (Geek 6/Historian 4/Manager 6) devours fantasy, history, and sci-fi books for breakfast, or really anytime he has a few minutes to read. His most frequently used feats are: Midas Touch, Satisfy Partners, Locate Anyone/Anything. He is a dedicated GM and RPG enthusiast and does business development in the computer gaming industry using his research background as a medieval historian.   

David (Geek 6/Corp. Executive 13) fiddles with a D20 and dreams of dragons and dungeons after his top-level executive meetings in his office. He balances random encounters versus party levels in his head as he pushes the stroller in the park. It is his lifelong wish to become a successful RPG publisher. So let's help Dave fulfill his dreams! His fate depends on you...

 

Illustrators 

Zsolt, David and Gergő are some of the most talented illustrators we have ever met during our extensive experience of working with professional artists and they collaborated on our previous module as well. They usually work for big international gaming brands but we all hope that we can keep them busy for a long time with a successful campaign.

David: https://www.artstation.com/davidszaboart

Zsolt: https://www.artstation.com/zsoltkosa

Gergő: https://www.artstation.com/qbrt-cubeart

 

The Matrons of Malice perform the dark ritual on the crown as Krasnar's body is burned on a pyre built from the hag-tree as the ghost of King Dasmag sings his lament

 

The total budget is planned to be allocated to cover illustrations and designs, creating soundscapes, and of course those unfortunate taxes and fees. We do all the writing, which we enjoy doing a lot. Of course, we wouldn't mind making some money on the project if the campaign blew up, but as illustration costs are quite high, we expect that our main reward will be the realization of the product, which is a fantastic result for us in itself.

Based on our experience with our first module, and keeping in mind that Crown of the Oathbreaker is a more ambitious project and several times longer, we expect to finish the core product by the end of 2021. The edited pdf version of the product should be available by December. The printing takes two additional months and it will probably take another month for the freight company to deliver our products to our US warehouse from the manufacturer. This means that the hardcover version and the booster cards will be available probably by March-April 2022. 

A melancholic Despair Giant of the Shadowrealm

 

 

Delivery of digital products

All digital products will be sent via email.

Delivery of physical products

Printing costs are not included in any of the listed perks but will have to be paid directly at Elderbrain.com when ordering your physical products (book and/or cards) with the discount code in the value of your pledge, which we will send you via email.

We charge printing costs later because we started out by offering a DriveThruRPG print-on-demand solution to deliver the physical products but we realized that we can achieve a lower production cost and better quality by doing everything ourselves. With this, we would cut the price of the now almost 600-page book to one-third of its previous price.  We have researched the best manufacturer, freight company, and fulfillment service provider we could find to accomplish this.

We expect the module to be about 550-600 pages long and we will prepare the print files for the 8.5” x 11” large print format. The hardcover book will be sewn bound and printed on 128 gsm paper. The printing costs of the final hardcover book will be +$25 and it will be +$12 for the two booster card decks (packed in a neat combo box). These are the extra costs that you will have to pay for the physical products above the value of your pledge. 

 

Shipping costs are also not included in any of the listed prices, they will be added to your order at Elderbrain.com when ordering your physical product.
story_txt:
Welcome to Crown of the Oathbreaker! >>> Pre-orders are available at Elderbrain.com <<<Crown of the Oathbreaker is a D&D 5e compatible dark adventure campaign taking characters from levels 5 to 12. The story is set in multi-layered sandbox realms, in which the players will uncover dark secrets from the past of a royal family after the fall of a blessed era and break a curse that plagues the kingdom. The cursed Crown of Azennar The players will have to explore lands ravaged by the curse and travel to the Feyrealm, the Shadowrealm, and even Hell, where they will face hard moral dilemmas before saving the crown from the dreadful effects of an otherwise inevitable pact. A sinister bargain has caused suffering for the people of the land and has created a mad witch-knight hungering for revenge.The adventure is partially set in Aglarion, a blossoming kingdom where all intelligent races are part of society and live in tolerance. This means that players can choose to play exotic monstrous races and still function effectively throughout the adventure.  Download the 10-page Adventure Summary booklet to learn every detail of the complete campaign background and the storyline of each chapter. SPOILER ALERT! The summary contains massive amounts of spoilers, so don’t read it unless you plan to be the GM for this adventure module.Krasnar Azennar, aberration infused lich-knight heir to the crown Crown of the Oathbreaker is based on an elaborate survey, which had over 2000 responses from dedicated RPG fans. We took the results and created an intricately woven story that incorporates every element of the desired aspects of a great adventure as decided by the community. Thank you again if you took part in this communal effort!You can still fill out the survey if you missed it. Your votes could shift the adventure in new directions.    Caress of the Elderbrain Based on the survey results, Crown of the Oathbreaker is a mix between sandbox and classic storylines, with a healthy blend of combat and non-combat encounters for all types of gameplay. It also combines elements of both high and dark fantasy, resulting in a singular style. Our approach was to come up with unique twists on classic features for every game aspect that was covered in the survey.Here are some of the major pillars of the adventure, as decided by the voting: The adventure takes the players to the three most favored planar settings: the Feyrealm, the Shadowrealm, and Hell. From 1 (I don't like it) to 4 (I love it) the result is clear, so the adventure features a combination of several intricately woven sandbox settings connected with some short linear storylines. The archvillain is a complex recurring enemy - a hexblade oathbreaker paladin infused with the power of an entity from the far realms who eventually becomes a lich-knight. Download the complete evaluation of the survey results to see how the responses to each section shaped the final adventure. The adventure and the campaign setting are also influenced by our community through our Discord server.  Join the discussion, add your thoughts, check out the latest content, and merge your intellect with the Elderbrain! We think everyone would agree that the quality of the finished product is paramount for both content and design. The community has decided and has confirmed our own love of playing long campaigns with a lot of unique monsters and NPCs. We appreciate it when such a product is heavily illustrated in color, packed with loads of maps, as well as scenes, monsters, items, and NPC illustrations. We are aiming for both the best quality and the highest possible quantity of artwork.The midnight hags Tyke, Blister, and Splinter - the Matrons of Malice Adventure moduleThe core product covered by our initial funding is an approximately 500-page D&D 5e compatible adventure campaign, including a 50-page Player's Guide and Campaign Setting section with a complete detailed description of the Kingdom of Aglarion, and the capital City of Onadbyr.The core adventure module contains the following elements:
5 large sandbox maps with over 100 encounter locations in each
27 dungeon maps with GM and player versions
36 new subclasses/archetypes, three for each base class 
15 different character background options to tie characters into the setting
38 adventure scene illustrations

180+ NPCs, all of them with illustrated portraits 
34 new unique magic items with illustrations 
29 new unique illustrated monsters and 4 new monster templates 
15 new spells and 13 new feats with illustrations
 Your own customizable and upgradable huge Battle Snail mount from the Feyrealm Booster cardsHand out the illustrated magic item cards to your players when they obtain a new unique item and spare them the time otherwise wasted on taking long notes, or asking you several times about their powers or what the item looks like.Use the monster and NPC portrait cards to show players with whom they are interacting and you will only have to flip them to see their stat block.Each card has an illustration on one side and a descriptive text with stats on the other side. All cards are 2.5” x 3.5” embossed stock cards with 11.0-pt. (280 micrometers) thickness, 320 gsm, black core card stock from German paper manufacturer Koehler, incorporating a subtle raised texture that creates air pockets for easier shuffling and dealing.Cards are also be available in PDF format.The 120-card Booster Pack includes the following cards:
NPC cards (47 cards)
Magic item cards (34 cards)
Monster cards (15 cards)
Spell cards (13 cards)
Feat cards (11 cards)
A Wand of the Mimic is a great tool to turn your couch into a vicious watchdog SoundscapesWe have created the free Elderbrain Soundscapes app to bring the atmosphere of each scene to you in the most diverse way. The app is always going to be free to use with every soundscape included.  Each soundscape is composed of several dozen dynamically and constantly changing sounds that each play at random times, direction, length, distance, reverb, and velocity to create an infinitely unique ambiance with no repetitions. The following soundscapes are already part of our live free app:
The City of Onadbyr 
The Bleak Mire 
King’s Games  
Cursed Land  
Undead City 
Undead Army 
Gibbering Fort 
Battle of the Champions 
Shadow Requiem 
Monster Menagerie 
Feast of the Satyr King 
Underdark 
Holy Temple 
 We have also launched a Patreon page to support the expansion of the Soundscape app with new sounds and features, delivering a sound every month: https://www.patreon.com/elderbraincomThe Patreon is also dedicated to creating A Crown of the Oathbreaker comic book to visualize the complete story of the adventure from different points of view. One or two pages will be published every month and made available to our kind Patreon members if our goals are reached. The Bulbous Observer is a massive floating abomination capable of keeping watch over large areas We have created a simplified reward structure so that everyone may find the most suitable one for them. The listed prices don’t include printing and shipping costs, which will be handled and calculated at Elderbrain.com during checkout when you place your order there.The Year of Rogue Dragons pdf, the Crown of the Oathbreaker Character Sheet pdfs, the Discord role code, and the survey link is sent in an e-mail to all new eligible backers during the first week of every month. PDF Version ($20)You will receive the complete adventure, including the Campaign Setting, and the Player’s Guide in PDF format. PDF + Physical Version ($25)You will receive the complete adventure, the Campaign Setting, and the Player’s Guide in PDF format and the ability to order the printed book from Elderbrain.com at the cost of printing and shipping. PDF + Physical Version + All extras ($49) You will receive the complete adventure, the Campaign Setting, and the Player’s Guide in PDF format and the ability to order the printed book from Elderbrain.com at the cost of printing and shipping.PLUS up to 120 illustrated Booster CardsPLUS a free PDF copy of our platinum seller 100-page adventure module “Year of Rogue Dragons”PLUS a PDF format character sheet designed for Crown of the Oathbreaker All in one + Become an NPC! ($99)You will receive the complete adventure, the Campaign Setting, and the Player’s Guide in PDF format and the ability to order the printed book from Elderbrain.com at the cost of printing and shipping. PLUS up to 120 illustrated Booster CardsPLUS a free PDF copy of our platinum seller 100-page adventure module “Year of Rogue Dragons”PLUS a PDF format character sheet designed for Crown of the OathbreakerPLUS you will be immortalized as one of the NPCs in the adventure with your own likeness in their portrait! Tell us your NPC's gender/race/class/occupation/features/looks and we will insert your character into the setting.

story:
Board Game Geek Page

 

Languages

Through this campaign you can order an English or a French version (you can select the prefered version in the pledge manager).

If you prefer a German version, please go to the campaign on Spieleschmiede.

 

Preview Barry Doublet - Board Games Everybody Should...

Preview The Hungy Gamer

Preview Vin d'jeu (French)

 

Preview Nox Spellenzolder (Dutch)

Want to read the rulebook? This isn't in final layout yet, but already complete. If you want to learn more about the setup, also check the setup-guide. With the print & play you can take a look at al the cardboard components and cards. This way you can check all abilities of the aliens, exiled forces and warp guardians or the mission cards in the game.

We only have to add the solo mode that will follow later. You can find more information about the solo mode in this thread. 

We offer 3 options.

  • Basic pledge: You receive the base game (1-4 players), all stretch goals and the Kickstarter Exclusive aliens.
  • Full pledge: You receive the base game (1-4 players), the expansion ( 5-6 players), all stretch goals and the Kickstarter Exclusive alien.
  •  Group pledge: Minimum 3 copies of the base game. You can add additional copies of the base game or the expansion to this group pledge You receive a discount and this option offers heavily reduced shipping.

Keep in mind, the final design and colors of the components can still be optimized during the final editing process.

All of the above will be included in the base version of the game (1-4 players). If you want the full experience up to 6 players you can also add the expansion to your order. This will contain the following:

You can add an add-on to your pledge by increasing the amount of your pledge with the price of the add-on. You can use the pledged amount in the pledge manager when the campaign ends to add the add-on to your order. Adding an add-on doesn't increase the shipping cost. Click the image below for more information.

 2 extra aliens will follow as soon as the sketches are ready.

This add-on pack will include:

  • 6 player aliens cards
  • 6 new exiled forces (printed on the back)
  • 6 new warp guardians cards

In total you’ll receive 12 cards in 120*80mm format.

 All stretch goals are in euro.

7002 CE. It’s been five years since a mysterious cataclysm destroyed several colonies on the planet Yortar. The subsequent gravitational distortions ravaged the planet and ended the golden age of interplanet trade and mining. Completely forsaken by the rest of the universe, the remaining colonies have endured in solitude behind their protective domes. But their survival has come at a great cost as revolts and banishments have vastly altered most societies.

As the dust of social unrest is settling and the endless spacetime fluctuations are finally starting to diminish, the new leadership of each colony is looking outward again but with different agendas. Some leaders want to research new technologies to rebuild and improve living conditions for their citizens. Others will be seeking domination over the other colonies through conquest or by manipulating the exiled. Certain are hoping to reclaim their vast riches by rebuilding the abandoned gold mines and controlling trade. Some are only interested in answers, or even better, satisfy the general lust of the populace for vengeance. What and who caused the cataclysm? Are the rumors about secret experiments with a warping portal true?

Whichever road is chosen, the results will determine what species will remain in power and which will succumb to revolution.

Multiplayer

In this standard competitive mode all players will take on each other to achieve the most mission points. With the extreme amount of possibilities to configure a game the replayability is almost unlimited and with random setup you will never play the same game twice.

Team Mode

It’s also possible to play The Warp in team mode. In this mode you will co-operate with a teammate to defeat your common foes. Team mode offers you the chance to discuss your individual strategy and draft your alien species and missions together during setup. With the base game you can play 2 vs 2. The expansion also makes it possible to play 2 vs 2 vs 2.

Solo Mode

The game features a campaign based solo mode against an automa rival. You start with a limited pool of aliens to choose from. Like in the multiplayer game you combine 2 of them for your current mission. Choose an alien rival with a specific playing style and a unique way of scoring mission points. When you succeed you can recruit the alien species for your further adventures on the planet Yortar and you will unlock new rivals. 

Of course we are completely convinced about The Warp, but the game has been playtested by many players. Here are some other opinions about the game:

Shipping will be charged through the pledge manager when the campaign is over. You don't have to add it to your pledge amount. You can find the safe estimates in the table below. Final prices will depend on the final weight and the volume we have to ship. Also big changes in the EUR/USD conversion rate can cause fluctuations. We'll do our best to maintain the prices listed below and we will provide clear communication if there would be a reason to increase them.

We are quite experienced in shipping through Europe so we'll process these shipments ourselves so we can guarantee a high standard. For other regions we'll use partners that are experienced in the fulfilment of board games.

You can find more information about the group pledge in update 14 on Kickstarter. Adding the Alien add-on pack doesn't increase the shipping price!

We are Jumping Turtle Games a board game publisher based in Belgium. We published our first game in 2013 and both do localizations as introduce our own titles. We have introduced several new authors in the past years and now we are very excited to launch this campaign for The Warp from Thomas Snauwaert. Thomas did a tremendous work developing and balancing this game and it was a pleasure working with him. He is very open for comments about the gameplay and always found solutions for problems we and other playtesters challenged him with.

With about 40 games and expansions published and 7 years of experience we aren't new to the business. We know what we have to do to bring the game to the market. The Warp is fully tested (over 200 playtests) and we are eager to get this game published. We hope we also got you excited for our game and you want to support us during this campaign to make the dream of Thomas and us a reality!

With the extreme amount of possibilities to configure a game the replayability is almost unlimited and with random setup you will never play the same game twice.Team ModeIt’s also possible to play The Warp in team mode. In this mode you will co-operate with a teammate to defeat your common foes. Team mode offers you the chance to discuss your individual strategy and draft your alien species and missions together during setup. With the base game you can play 2 vs 2. The expansion also makes it possible to play 2 vs 2 vs 2.Solo ModeThe game features a campaign based solo mode against an automa rival. You start with a limited pool of aliens to choose from. Like in the multiplayer game you combine 2 of them for your current mission. Choose an alien rival with a specific playing style and a unique way of scoring mission points. When you succeed you can recruit the alien species for your further adventures on the planet Yortar and you will unlock new rivals. Of course we are completely convinced about The Warp, but the game has been playtested by many players. Here are some other opinions about the game:Shipping will be charged through the pledge manager when the campaign is over. You don't have to add it to your pledge amount. You can find the safe estimates in the table below. Final prices will depend on the final weight and the volume we have to ship. Also big changes in the EUR/USD conversion rate can cause fluctuations. We'll do our best to maintain the prices listed below and we will provide clear communication if there would be a reason to increase them.We are quite experienced in shipping through Europe so we'll process these shipments ourselves so we can guarantee a high standard. For other regions we'll use partners that are experienced in the fulfilment of board games.You can find more information about the group pledge in update 14 on Kickstarter. Adding the Alien add-on pack doesn't increase the shipping price!We are Jumping Turtle Games a board game publisher based in Belgium. We published our first game in 2013 and both do localizations as introduce our own titles. We have introduced several new authors in the past years and now we are very excited to launch this campaign for The Warp from Thomas Snauwaert. Thomas did a tremendous work developing and balancing this game and it was a pleasure working with him. He is very open for comments about the gameplay and always found solutions for problems we and other playtesters challenged him with.With about 40 games and expansions published and 7 years of experience we aren't new to the business. We know what we have to do to bring the game to the market. The Warp is fully tested (over 200 playtests) and we are eager to get this game published. We hope we also got you excited for our game and you want to support us during this campaign to make the dream of Thomas and us a reality!

story:
Meeple Light is a stylish and bright way to display your love of board games. It is a giant Meeple with 19 dynamic color patterns to choose from and 20 static color options. Multiple lighting patterns and static colors are easily chosen with the attached 3 button USB controller. It comes with a tree attachment that will allow it to fit atop most Christmas trees during the holiday season.

Display it on:

- Board game shelf (next to your ever growing collection)

- Top of your holiday tree

- Office desk as a conversation piece

- Public gaming table, to attract new players

- An end table as a nightlight

- Windowsill to act as a beacon for your fellow board gamers showing up for game night

- Anywhere you can plug a USB! If used with a USB battery pack it can be used anywhere!

 

 

 

-Testimonials-

 

 Adam's review can be seen here:

 

 

 

-Lightless Meeples- 

 

 

We are also making available Lightless Meeples in solid colors. These Meeples are available in the standard player colors: Red, Yellow, Blue, and Green. Other colors are the Chalkboard, Golden, Purple, Orange and Pink. The Meeples are hollow and each foot has a 1 inch hole in which you could hold accessories like dice. You can put some sand to weigh it down and you could place it outside as a decoration!

 

Your color choice of the Lightless Meeple(s) you order will be requested with the pledge manager that will be sent out later.


I am happy to have found a local company that will be producing the Meeple body. Being able to oversee the production will ensure a high quality product while also supporting local craftsmen. This also means the product will avoid shipping delays and difficulties in customs, imports and cargo container issues that are hampering other crowdfunding platforms at the moment. The Meeples will be picked up from the local factory and production/shipping will be finished on site. This will result in faster reward delivery and reduce the pollution created from the resources that would be used to have these shipped from overseas.

The electrical components come from China and will be assembled in America. I am continuing to search for electronics locally made.

 

 Chit Biggy: In-Game Resource Organizer

Chit Biggies are 8 inches wide and can handle most games' components. I find during gameplay that a person ends up needing multiple resources and has to reach over everyone to either get new resources or put old ones back. This blocks other players' sight and becomes tedious fidgeting across the board to collect everything. With these large in-game organizers you can hand all the game's resources to any player with ease. They are 3D printed using a Marble Rainbow and Galaxy Black with more colors being unlocked as stretch goals are surpassed.

 

 Chit Mini: In-Game Individual Resource Organizer

The Chit Minis are useful for passing a single resource type or for each player to keep their own personal resources organized. They are available in Marble Rainbow and Galaxy Black with more colors being unlocked as stretch goals are surpassed.

 

Meeple-ments: Ornaments for your tree!

 Meeple-ments are hanging ornaments that are 2 x 2 inches and hang from a tree or stocking stuffers for the holidays. These are 3D printed and will be available in Red, Yellow, Blue, Green, White and Black for a total of 6 ornaments to spread cheer!

 

Shipping will be handled when your waved shipping is coming up. You will be emailed with a request for your address and payment from the backer survey.

Shipping will be done in waves, beginning with the earliest backers.

 

*UK & EU Backers:

With new VAT rules for the UK/EU, shipping is difficult and costly for new businesses. In order to make this manageable and lower the cost to you, we will be using our Etsy Store to handle the shipping. If we were to ship without using Etsy you would be charged the same amount of VAT along with a handling fee which can range wildly. With Etsy, the handling fee is waived by customs and VAT is collected upfront so you will not have unexpected costs. A $5 pledge option will be enabled for EU/UK to reserve a spot for the first few waves of shipping and have access to voting on the stretch goals. The cost on Etsy will reflect the $5 you paid on Indiegogo. If getting Add-ons, they will be part of the Etsy listing specific to you.

 

Rest of the World (Global):

All physical rewards are shipped out from America and international backers are responsible for any import taxes, tariffs, service fees, customs fees, and duties established by their country. Please keep this in mind when you pledge, as you may be charged fees (such as VAT) that are not included in the cost. You will be emailed about the shipping cost from PledgeBox. Once paid it will be shipped to your address. If your country requires a VAT to be paid, your courier will usually notify you of that cost upon delivery. Our policy is to put the price of goods sold (how much you paid) on all applicable customs forms. Failure to pay custom fees or incorrect address resulting in a return to sender will have reship costs deducted from your refund.

Unfortunately, we cannot guarantee shipping times for international backers. We will do everything in our power to get your order out quickly, but especially with COVID-19 still impacting global logistics we can’t promise an in-hand date. Wherever possible, we will ship international orders with tracking.

 

Timeline:

October: Production Begins

November: Shipping begins. Wave 1

December: Wave 2

January: Wave 3

February: Wave 4

story:
UNLIMITED POSSIBILITIES, PRO RESULT : NEVER EVER BUY A NAMEPLATE AGAIN !

We can talk a lot about our products, but seeing them by yourself is definitely the best way to convince you : https://cults3d.com/en/users/Wargname/creations

There are many free nameplates for you to test :)

We already more than a hundred of satisfied customers, and this KS will give you the possibility to do most of the nameplates you see there!

With this Kickstarter, Warg'Name is providing you with a set of "premade templates" of different shapes and sizes so you can MAKE or SELL your own nameplates with a PRO result!

Warhammer 40K(c), Age of Sigmar(c), Blood Bowl, Warcry(c), Warhammer Quest(c), Dungeons and Dragons(c), Infinity the gam(c), Marvel Crisis Protocol(c), or ANY OTHER game you know...

The possibilities are HUGE!

Hi, My name is Alex, and this is my 3rd Kickstarter. 

About a year ago, because I couldn't find affordable generic nameplates for my miniatures, I started selling nameplates on Kickstarter under the Warg'Name brand.

My will at first was to provide to the community affordable and easy to print by yourselves nameplates for the games who require generic tagging : Bloodbowl, Warcry, Warhammer Quest... And to help some makers adding a personal touch to their project (see Greg Kourakos' 2 kickstarters, Wukong and Pit Fighter)

After a year, I felt greatly dissatisfied. 

I kept receiving demands for specific nameplates, and also it still took me a very long time to make all the nameplates for the games, because of the different sizes, the different designs, the different fonts... And mostly because people wanted their mini to be unique (Like I do myself!)

How to solve that?

The answer came from Greg Kourakos and some of my resellers.  

Alex, you should stop selling nameplates, but sell templates so that people can make their own nameplates!

 

And here we are. 

Well, while preparing the Kickstarter, we wondered if everyone might be familiar with nameplates. So this is our 2 cents about it.

Nameplates are little plates that can be flat or curved, made of resin, that you put in front of your miniature base. they are mostly the same height or a little more than the base, and if done well, they follow the base perfectly.

The size of the nameplate is mostly separated between those : a little less than 90° of the base, a little more than 90° of the base, almost 180° or a full ring.

We decided to base our nameplates on around 135° arc. 

I will not lie to you : it's not a 2 clics nameplate generator. It's more like a 10-20 clics nameplate maker.

I will basically provide you everything until the very last step so that you can make nameplates with blender. Once the software installed, you will just have to:

  •  choose your nameplate style
  • choose your greeblies
  • choose your text, 
  • choose your font, 
  • and export. done.

For most nameplates, you don't need to learn anything. Just follow the provided guide. For some advanced models (like carved ones) there are 4-5 more steps and really easy  tricks to follow.

I wanted to make a video to show how it works, but Ben, from the Bonehead Podcast, was faster than me:

 

That's it.

And if you are still asking yourself about the difference between the 3D model and the final result, watch this :

Regarding your pledge, you will have access to :

  • A document that specifies how to use the nameplate creator
  • A document that specifies how to presupport your nameplates
  • A document that specifies how to paint your nameplates on Non Metallic Metal style
  • Different Templates
  • Different Sizes for the templates
  • Different greeblies
  • One year of updates after the KS

Regarding sizing :

Some specific templates, like for bloodbowl, will be provided with limited number of sizes that fits the game.

Is becoming a reseller worth it?

Well, think about it. If you are in a club, you at least 5 or 6 people who needs nameplates for their teams. If you have a local miniature seller (or if you are one), maybe he'll be happy to add those to what he can sell to his customers. 

A physical nameplate sells today from 2€ to 5.5€ regarding the complexity/size. 

A bloodbowl(c) team for example is 16 minis. A game like the last warhammer quest is about 50 minis.  A dungeons and Dragons Party is 4-6 characters.  A 40K army or a AoS one includes easily 5 to 10 named characters... And the printing of a full plate is less than a euro of resin. It's really easy to get back on your investment, not even counting what you will print for yourself!

There are many ways to sell :

You can decide to be full custom, like an established nameplate reseller. Let the customers choose their size, their nameplate style, their greeblies, their fonts.... And give you the names they are looking for.

you can prepare some styles, adapted to different games, and just give your customers the possibility to change the names. This way you can sell on different platforms, like etsy, ebay ...

You can prepare nameplates like we did for bloodbowl, warcry, cursed city.... and sell them in bulk, printed or as STLs

Our ONLY condition : Warg'Name's logo has to be apposed near every image of nameplate you made with our nameplate creator. This will help on one side promoting our work, and on the other side, it will be a proof of quality for your buyers. 

What about the competitors? Well, find me people that can sell as fast as you can around your place, be there to support... The market is increasing but still young, so the needs will all develop! Becoming a reseller is a way to participate in the community. You can also sign in with friends!

All stretch Goals have been unlocked during the kickstarter. This is a recapitulative list showing you all the styles available (don't bother the colors, all is unlocked).

Let's have a look at the full list:

for the nameplate styles, title means it is meant to be used as a nameplate with title, oval means the design will also be made for oval nameplates. 

 

For the greeblies, most are available in different positions to fit the styles. I show you different examples to work your imagination. You can also mix and match them to your needs.

The restrictions are mostly for big sizes, or for oval nameplates.

 

 

 Special : Marvel : Crisis Protocol and Infinity the Game nameplates + Star Wars Legion.

Those were a real challenge, because they don't follow the standard models I use. So instead of forcing people to use the GW nameplates shapes for it, I decided to limit the choice of greeblies/models available, but adapt them exactly to the original base.

Definitely, if you want to print by yourself, you need a resin printer. There are established brands, a lot bringing affordable machines : anycubic, elegoo, longer, phrozen... We tested our nameplates to be printed on 0.05mm on a Elegoo Mars pro. The sold nameplates will be printed on Phrozen sonic mini 4K on 0.035, with anycubic transparent green resin (the one we found to have the best properties).

We tried to exaggerate most details on the templates so that they are visible on the final product.

Don't worry about that, All will be delivered on a google drive, where you will have access to everything :) And Also the organisation will be clear so that you don't lose time searching for your nameplate's templates. 

Rob Baer, SpikeyBits

 

Greg Kourakos, 3dPrintingPro

 

"Never used blender before, but was really easy to get the hang of! Warg'Name's plates are all you ever need!"

Paints on 4 up

 

"Holy shit man they are incredible. The new plates are exactly what I was hoping for. The competition will definitely be unhappy. This is amazing.”

"Yeah, I'm really impressed. You've outdone yourself with this one".

Sean John, Reseller, Jester Prints

 

"Just did some random stuff on it, everything turned out great I'm well impressed with the program"

"I'd just do a basic write up, I'm not great with blender but after 10 minutes playing around it was easy to use"

"Lots of options, best program I've seen"

"I can't see anyone not liking it"

Lee Dean, Reseller, KL Printing Emporium

 

"The instructions are very well organised, thank goodness!"

"Wow! This is brilliant!  I've already knocked together a couple, great guide, great assets! This is awesome!!"

"There's so so much customisation in there"

"I think something that *needs* to come across is that this is more like Software than an STL!  €45 for unlimited customisable bases is very very very agreeable!"

Ben Greenman, the Bonehead Podcast

 

Games Workshop(R), the Games Workshop logo,  and all associated marks, names, races, race insignia, characters, vehicles, locations, units, illustrations and images from their fantasy football game,  are either ®, TM and/or © Copyright Games Workshop Ltd 2000-2021, variably registered in the UK and other countries around the world. Used without permission. No challenge to their status intended. All Rights Reserved to their respective owners.

story:
The Opening Story

The Variable Payload Raider, or Viper Suit, as the troops call it, is a modular mech chassis originally designed for construction, mining, and exploration. Intrepid colonists system-wide use Vipers in every manner of hard vacuum and hostile environment. The bipedal vehicles have proved to be rugged, durable, and easily printed and assembled, even from hobbyist weld-printers or simpler models of colonial material fabricator boxes (fabboxes).

Humans being humans, though, the Viper Suit was soon pressed into combat.  The modular nature of the Viper makes it able to be fitted with weaponry from the Earth Defense Forces, the Titan Marines, or any other faction that wants to protect its oxygen and ore. Protective plating forged to stop incoming micrometeorites can also resist small arms fire. Open-source weapon files and ammunition recipes are readily found on the SystemNet.

Mankind didn’t leave violence behind on Earth. The Viper Suit is proof that any tool, even one that is 18 feet tall, can be reforged into a weapon.

Tell Me More.  Now.

Like the opening text stated in such flowery prose, the Viper Suit is pretty simple.

It's a downloadable package of .stl files so you can print a physical model of the Viper Suit mech. Stereolithography, or STL for short, is the format most printers take.

At its simplest, The Viper Suit is hull, legs, and weapons, with the potential for more add-ons and other figures.  Where we go from there is a matter of stretch goals that will indicate how much more folks want. If things go well, there’s potential for redesigning some old 15mm Rebel Minis favorites, updating and refreshing the designs for both scales.

GunCATs, RUMV civilian vehicles, new power armors, detailed interior cockpits, stowage sets, and much, much more. And Jetpacks. Jetpacks!!!

Along the way, we’ll also have discounted digital files for 28mm and 15mm tanks, armored vehicles, and even Megatanks! Woot! Megatanks!

 

 

 

 

 

 

Will There Be Physical Models? I don’t have a printer. Yet.

While we encourage every hobbyist to get their own 3D printer, we understand that finances and space requirements don’t always make that possible.

We are going to sell commercial licenses, five on this Kickstarter, five others world-wide through other means, to service bureaus and entrepreneurs with printers who can take orders, print, and ship physical models to your address.

Or, convince your boss at work that the office really, really needs one. Don’t ask why, boss, just order it!

 

Which Printer Should I Get?

There are two major types of printers on the market.  FDM printers, which extrude a thin string of hot plastic layer by layer on top of each other until you have a physical object, or resin printers, which flash-cure objects out of a tank of gooey resin, layer by layer.

Both types are capable of great prints. Resin printers have a slight edge on detail and ease of operation, but can be messier to clean up. We recommend resin printers, despite the post-processing drudgery. Keeping a clean, well-ventilated workspace is key. Lots of rubbing or wood alcohol, rubber gloves, and paper towels helps.

The Viper Suit was test-printed on an Elegoo Saturn resin 3D printer. The Saturn has proved to be a reliable workhorse, with capable resolution, great speed, and a generous build envelope.   You can get one delivered via Amazon Prime for $500 USD.

https://smile.amazon.com/ELEGOO-Photocuring-Act...

Now, that’s a lot of money. You can go smaller, or you can split the costs with a friend, family member, or local gaming club. I highly recommend the Saturn, though. I have no affiliation or endorsement deal. I’m just a happy customer who likes things that work.

If the Saturn is out of the budget, there’s always the Elegoo Mars 2 Pro. It’s a proven printer with lots of aftermarket and consumer support. You’re limited in build envelope, but not resolution. It and other printers its size are probably ideal, if you’re just going to do 15mm Viper Suits.

https://smile.amazon.com/dp/B0957CK52T

You can go cheaper, and you can often find the above printers on sale. Those are the ones we can recommend, though, for personal use.

Magnetization? What’s That?

Some parts of the model will need to be glued together. We recommend a gel super glue. Larger models like the Viper Suit, though, lend themselves to swapping out components.

There is an option for twist-lock joints at the shoulders, but we also made arrangements for magnets to be incorporated into the design.

Specifically, neodyminium magnets 8 millimeters in diameter that are 3mm thick. If you have 8mm x 2mm or 8mm x 1mm, those are cool, too, but you might need to stack them or combine them with steel washers for optimum hold.

You can buy a 100-pack of these magnets on Amazon at https://smile.amazon.com/DIYMAG-Refrigerator-Ma...

We have also found them at our neighborhood hardware store, though they are in smaller packs. It’s good to support your local hardware store, though. Unless they’re mean, of course.

 

I like Stretch Goals.  What Stretch Goals Are Planned?

We are but simple prototyper folk, and do not have outrageous demands nor extravagant dreams.

Here’s what we have planned.

At $250 USD- We fund!  That Viper Suit goodness is guaranteed to be in your inbox at the end of the campaign, once the money clears.

 

At $500 USD, If this initial goal is reached, we’ll offer our own 100mm and 50mm Scenic Bases and Base Toppers for existing bases. These round disks and accessories will be Industrial and Futuristic in nature.

If you want your own non-printed bases, we can recommend a set.  For 28mm Vipers, we endorse 100mm bases from Reaper Minis. They have their own injection molding machine, and keep things in-house. https://smile.amazon.com/Reaper-Miniatures-100m...

If’n you’re making 15mm Vipers, we recommend the 2-inch bases from Reaper (51mm for you metric types). https://smile.amazon.com/Round-Plastic-Miniatur...

At $1000 USD- JBR will sculpt up a detailed VPR Cockpit with control displays, ejection seat, and other fiddly bits. The referenc pic is from an A-10, so some liberties will be taken. And a jetpack for the Viper Suit. Because why not? Jetpack!!!

At $1500 USD- Off-Planet Colonial Stowage Set. Rolled-up survival bubble tents, bulk storage containers, tool boxes, personal storage units, ammunition cans, and even a beer cooler! Everything to make your life as a colonial militia Viper pilot a little easier. And a colonist-sized jetpack for your own figures. Jetpack!!!

At $2000 USD- Gun Drones and Repair Drones.  Is that power-spanner just out of reach? Have your robotic hangar buddy bring it over to you. Or lift that missile off you that fell of its ready rack. These drones will be modified and updated to serve as well as protect.

At $2500 USD- The CATs are Cybernetic Autonomous Troopers will be upgraded and redesigned for 28mm. Towering assault and support units with electronic minds of their own. They fulfill a variety of battlefield roles, from fire support to tank-busting. TomCATs, GunCATs, FireCATs, and even the anti-armor PanzerCATs! And jetpacks for the CATs. CAT Jetpack!!!

At $3000 USD- The Titan Marines liked the concept of the Viper Suit, but their cold arrogance forces them to shun all things from the Inner Planets. They want their own Viper Suit. With a jetpack. Jetpack!!!

At $4000 USD- The RUMV system enables you to mix and match dozens of parts to make the ideal tabletop vehicle. At this level, we can offer a Civilian Flatbed vehicle with multiple means of movement (legs, hover, wheeled, tracked, and a-grav) with numerous new accessories for that modular area in the rear(Camper, APC, Improvised Colonial Tank, Recovery Vehicle, etc.).

At $5000 USD- Myrmidon Power Armors (Basic Infantry Trooper). Rebel Mike and I came up with the Myrmidon powered armour (spelled intentionally for you UK types) a few years ago, but it never made it past the prototyping and master-casting stage due to budget concerns. Direct 3D printing changes that. This design will be updated and put into circulation in both 28mm and 15mm versions. They’ll be nice and big, too, to take one those other guys from forty thousand years in the future. Of course, they’ll have jetpacks, too. Jetpacks!!!

At $6000 USD- The Mama Snake, as we like to call her! Viper Suits can get to the battlefield under their own power, but the MegaTank Carrier/Recovery Version gets them there in style. Disembarking from a front or rear ramp, up to four Viper Suits can be carried on this mammoth armored vehicle. There are options for recovery cranes and weapon turrets to provide support for downed armors or recovery crews.

Pictured above is one of our MegaTanks.  It will be modified to become the Mama Snake.

No jetpack for the Mama Snake. Are you nuts?  She will have an a-grav option, though. ?

 

How Does This Work?

Backers will get the base Viper Suit immediately after funds are finalized via a link from WeTransfer.com or a similar file transfer site.

After that, depending on how things go, stretch goals will be fulfilled and made available for download. Could be days. Could be weeks. Could be a few months for the big ones, like Mama Snake. I make sure to test-print models before I make them available, so I’m not handing over untested digital junk to you.

Why Crowdfunding?

Why run a crowdfunding campaign? Why not just put these on an e-store and wait for things to trickle in?

There are a few things.

One, crowdfunding is a great marketing tool. It not only has a built-in audience, but it’s a great gauge of market appetite.

Two, these files will be available on a variety of STL Store platforms like Cults3D, CGTrader, and MyMiniFactory, once the initial campaign is over. You’ll be getting a better price and package deal with the fundraising campaign, though, so best not to wait.

 

About Rebel Minis Digital Direct and John Bear Ross

Rebel Minis has been serving the tabletop wargame community for decades, now. Mike Renegar started it from his home in Tennessee, and it has grown to be a worldwide presence.

Rebel Minis Digital Direct is a small offshoot where Mike has let John tinker for years, hoping something would come of it.

The Viper Suit is the result of that patience. Hopefully, it pays off.

John Bear Ross has been a digital sculptor for over 20 years, working for Rebel, Reaper, Wizkids, Khurasan, Critical Mass, Conflict Horizon, among many many others.

We have a known history of delivering above and beyond customer expectations, including our Motorpool STL Kickstarter Effort from 2020. We won’t let you down.

Before You Go

Thanks for your time for scrolling through my screed.

I hope you consider pledging at any level that fits your budget. If you can't afford it, a public mention would do a lot to help me get the word out, and it's completely free to post on social media or tell a friend. Throw a link out there.

Gracias!

Best,

Rebel Mike and JBR
story_txt: The Opening StoryThe Variable Payload Raider, or Viper Suit, as the troops call it, is a modular mech chassis originally designed for construction, mining, and exploration. Intrepid colonists system-wide use Vipers in every manner of hard vacuum and hostile environment. The bipedal vehicles have proved to be rugged, durable, and easily printed and assembled, even from hobbyist weld-printers or simpler models of colonial material fabricator boxes (fabboxes).Humans being humans, though, the Viper Suit was soon pressed into combat.  The modular nature of the Viper makes it able to be fitted with weaponry from the Earth Defense Forces, the Titan Marines, or any other faction that wants to protect its oxygen and ore. Protective plating forged to stop incoming micrometeorites can also resist small arms fire. Open-source weapon files and ammunition recipes are readily found on the SystemNet.Mankind didn’t leave violence behind on Earth. The Viper Suit is proof that any tool, even one that is 18 feet tall, can be reforged into a weapon.Tell Me More.  Now.Like the opening text stated in such flowery prose, the Viper Suit is pretty simple.It's a downloadable package of .stl files so you can print a physical model of the Viper Suit mech. Stereolithography, or STL for short, is the format most printers take.At its simplest, The Viper Suit is hull, legs, and weapons, with the potential for more add-ons and other figures.  Where we go from there is a matter of stretch goals that will indicate how much more folks want. story:
What Will Gather 4 Games Have to Offer?

 

  • A large library of games (over 500 and growing!!!) available to play, catering to people of all ages.
  • Our snack bar cupboards are jam packed with delicious heat and eat treats, drinks, and desserts.
  • Innovative membership plans that reward repeated patronage, purchases of products and services and “level up”, earning loyal customers exclusive deals, and rewards
  • Daily, weekly, and monthly events, providing many opportunities for people to meet others with similar gaming interests.
  • Friendly, and knowledgeable staff to help get your gathered gaming in no time.

 

Why Do We Want to Open A Board Game Lounge

 

  • At Gather 4 Games, we believe something magical happens when people gather together, in the shared experience of a tabletop game. We want to bring this to the Phoenix community.
  • We believe there is a demand for dedicated family friendly entertainment in Phoenix. Tempe and Mesa have shown the gaming scene is alive and well in Arizona.
  • We are looking forward to teaching the classics as well as the up-and-coming hot games, and feeding the itch some may have in the community for a little friendly competition via daily, weekly, and monthly events.

 

Why We’re Crowdfunding

 

  • We’ve been working hard over the last year and a half making our dream of opening Gather 4 Games a reality. We want to give the Northern Phoenix Arizona tabletop gaming community the opportunity to help make that dream come true!
  • The $15,000 we’re raising will help us level up Gather 4 Games by helping us grow our library, cover the cost of equipment, legal and permitting fees, and allow us to get our feet on the ground, ensuring that we will be around for the long haul.
  • Check back often for the latest updates!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

 

  • Get the word out by joining, and sharing our Twitter, Instagram, and Facebook links!
    • Twitter (@Gather4Games)
    • Instagram https://www.instagram.com/gather4games/
    • Facebook page facebook.com/gather4games
    • Our website is currently under construction, but will be coming soon to: https://gather4games.com

story:
Digital encounter building tools for online play inspired by the national parks. Breathtaking battle maps, thematic monsters, heroic voice acting and gorgeous point of view art provide the tools to level up your game. 

 

WHAT IS A 5E NATIONAL PARK? 

A 5E national park is an assortment of digital content themed around one of the United States' National Parks.  The center piece of a 5E national park is a battle map that is useful for existing campaigns or a one-shot.  In addition to the map, the 5E national park comes with a PDF detailing the park's fantasy background, descriptions and encounters.  The PDF contains embedded video and voice narrated "box text" for added flavor.  All of the digital content comes as separate files so you can easily upload them to your favorite virtual table top.

 

WHICH PARKS WILL THIS KICKSTARTER BUILD?

PARK #1:  YELLOWSTONE!!! Is it true there is a primordial below Yellowstone?

The Yellowstone Point of View Art:

The Yellowstone Overland Battle Map (square grid version):

The Yellowstone Below Ground Battle Map (square grid version):

The Fearsome Mud Fiend (1 of 5 Yellowstone Monsters!):

PARK #2:  EVERGLADES!!!  What lurks in the water beneath the Mangrove roots?

The Everglades Point of View Art:

The Everglades Overland Battle Map (clean version):

The Everglades Under the Island Battle Map (clean version):

The Burmese Python (1 of 5 fearsome Everglade Monsters!)

PARK #3:  BRYCE CANYON!!!  What evil awaits you in the multiverse's greatest concentration of Hoodoos?  

PARK #4:  GREAT SAND DUNES!!!  What malevolent force evaporated the ancient lake and concentrated its sand?  Who warded the creeks and mountains to contain the sand?  And what else is contained beyond the wards, buried in the sand?

PARK #5:  SEQUOIA!!! This tree has observed mortal affairs for over 2,000 years.  What ancient knowledge does it know?

 

WHY 5E INSPIRED BY THE NATIONAL PARKS?

At the beginning of 2019 I was part of a fantastic in person 5E campaign.  Every other Monday night we got together at Garret's house and had a ball role-playing into the early hours of the morning.  After COVID, the group dispersed.  We tried to transition online but couldn’t recreate the in-person magic.  Meanwhile, I was DMing a game for my family online.  It was a great way to spend time with my brother and cousins who live in another state, but the role-playing wasn't as engaging as Garret's in-person campaign.  So during this last year of social distancing I've thought a lot about using digital tools to create great role-playing experiences online.  This project implements ways to engage players online including beautiful battle maps, short videos and narrated box text. 

 

BATTLE MAP EXAMPLE

A 40 x 30 battle map that is 162 pixels per square.  It comes in a simple sketch version (great for a player handout), detailed black and white version, full color gridded (square), full color gridded (hex) and full color ungridded (clean) versions.
